characters: MEET TAYLOR SLOANE, YOUR NEWEST GIRL CRUSH
TAYLOR'S LIFE, HER VOICE OVERLAPPING WITH ITSELF, THE IMA
AND PRAISE COMING FASTER AND FASTER...
THE VOICES START TO BLEND TOGETHER, WORDS OF ENCOURAGEMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid steps out of the car, wearing running shoes and a cocktail dress underneath her sweatshirt. We TRACK with h as she makes her way across the lawn, towards a large TEN filled with tables and people dancing. Ingrid weaves her way through the crowd, unnoticed. She grabs a glass of champagne from a passing caterer and slu it, tossing the empty glass aside as she notices --

dialogues.speaker: CHARLOTTE
dialogues.text: -- sitting at her table, still in her wedding dress, tell an animated story to a group of enthralled WEDDING GUESTS

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hi Charlotte. Charlotte and a few of her guests turn, smiling. Charlott recognizes Ingrid and just as suddenly her smile vanishes

dialogues.speaker: CHARLOTTE
dialogues.text: Ingrid...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Ingrid holds up a PEPPER SPRAY GUN and blasts Charlotte i the face. Charlotte squeezes her eyes shut, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: THANKS FOR INVITING ME, CUNT
dialogues.text: The party erupts into chaos. Charlotte’s bridesmaids rush her aid. Ingrid tries to make a run for it but is tackled the dance floor by a couple of athletic GROOMSMEN. CLOSE on Ingrid writhing on the floor and sobbing as we -

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A STATIC SHOT of the Pacific Ocean shimmering under a pin and orange sky. We HEAR the sound of waves crashing again the shoreline as the TITLE FADES IN --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID GOES WEST
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK to reveal that the beach is a motivational poster hanging on an otherwise empty wall.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dear Charlotte. A calmer, healthier-looking Ingrid sits on the edge of a bed inside the sterile room, staring up at the poster. Sh looks down at the notebook in her lap and continues writi

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I just want you to know how sorry I am about what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid steps up to a window where a nurse hands her a pap cup filled with medicine. She tosses back her pills and opens her mouth wide, sticking out her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In a lot of ways, having this time apart has been good for me. It’s given me a chance to reflect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid plays ping-pong against a pale 15-YEAR-OLD GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m learning how to be present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is eating a sandwich and reading a worn copy of Th Language of Letting Go, highlighting her favorite passage

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How to live in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid sits in a circle with a small group, nodding in sympathy as a female patient shares a harrowing story.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid and her fellow patients are sitting in chairs watc Clueless on a pull-down projector screen. Ingrid laughs, then pauses, remembering something.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sometimes I’1l hear a joke or see something that reminds me of you and I feel sad because I have no way of telling you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid sits cross-legged, meditating next to a large oak

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But maybe that’s okay. Maybe it’s good to feel alone once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid waves goodbye to the other patients, exchanging hu

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what the future holds for me. I just know that things are going to be different now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is waiting at the front desk clutching a faded L.L Bean backpack with her name stitched across the top. She makes sure no one is watching then reaches over the count and slides a stamped envelope into the OUTGOING MAIL bin.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hopefully someday you and I can look back on all of this and laugh. A NURSE appears, handing Ingrid a plastic bag filled with personal items. Ingrid opens the bag, taking out her IPHO CLOSE on the phone. We SEE Ingrid’s face reflected in the glass. She cradles it in her hand, caressing the screen.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your friend, always --

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ingrid! Ingrid turns, snapping out of her reverie. HER POV - Ingrid’s sister, ERIN, 32, pregnant and dressed catalog casual, stands in the lobby. She waves, hopeful. I/E. ERIN’S SUV (MOVING) - DAY Erin drives while Ingrid rides shotgun with her head out window, staring out at the Pennsylvania suburbs as they p by. She notices a Corona billboard with the slogan “Find Your Beach” and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late. I had to pull Logan out of karate class. His sensei had a cold sore. Ingrid turns towards the backseat, still glowing.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: How’s my little black belt, huh? Erin’s son, LOGAN, 4, sits in the back with headphones on staring at his iPad. He doesn’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way, if anyone asks, we told people you were at a yoga retreat.  6. Ingrid looks at Erin, confused. She laughs uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: For eight weeks?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We thought it’d be easier for you to not have to keep explaining to everyone where you were.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, the thing is... a big part of the healing process is learning how to talk about what happened and not care what other people think.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Totally get it. Keith and I just feel like all the hospital stuff might be a little heavy for Logan. He’s only in Pre-K.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: So what? You want me to pretend like everything's perfect?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: No! Of course not. You can talk about it as much as you want. Just as long as we're talking about yoga and not, you know... Ingrid is silent. This doesn’t sit well with her.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... do you want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Not anymore. They continue driving in silence. Ingrid turns back towar the window, her glow fading a bit. EXT. ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - ESTABLISHING A single-story Colonial house with a big yard. A police motorcycle is parked next to Erin’s SUV in the driveway.  INT. NURSERY - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - DAY The door opens and Erin’s husband KEITH, 39, enters weari short-sleeved cop uniform, his shirt unbuttoned revealing white tee underneath. He flicks on the light.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: -- and last but not least, I give you the Ingrid Suite. Voila. Ingrid enters, looking around, with Erin close behind. HER POV - A baby’s nursery has been transformed into a temporary guest room. There is a cozy-looking bed with fr flowers on the nightstand, a flat-screen TV, a basket fil with snacks and a banner that reads: “WELCOME HOME, INGRI

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (touched) You guys, this is so nice.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Stay as long as you want.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Our casa is su casa.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to do all this. I’1ll only be here a few days. Ingrid sets down her backpack and opens the closet. Erin Keith exchange a worried look.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Where were you planning on going?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (read: obviously) Back to Mom’s house? Where all my stuff is? Ingrid turns on the closet light and pauses. It’s filled with clothes and cardboard boxes labeled: “INGRID”

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We were gonna wait until you were settled in to tell you but --

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: (ripping off the band-aid) We sold the house, Ingrid.  Ingrid stares at them, completely blindsided.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Erin and Keith are standing outside the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Half that house was mine! She left it to both of us!

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Exactly. Which is why we put half of the money in a checking account under your name.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Big ol’ chunk of change, Ingrid. No response.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We figured you could use it. How else were we supposed to pay for all your medical bills? The door flies open and Ingrid appears, eyes red.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Don’t you mean my yoga retreat?!

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Easy, Ingrid --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No! Ever since Mom died, you guys have been waiting to kick me out. You just couldn't help yourselves, could you?!

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Ingy, that house was a dump. It was not a healthy environment for you. Ingrid sits on the bed and closes her eyes, doing a breat exercise, trying to calm herself.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I'd like to be alone now, please.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: (to Erin) Why don’t you tell her how much we got for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go fuck yourself? Silence. Erin gives Keith a look telling him to wait outs

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Okey-dokey. Keith exits. Erin sits next to Ingrid on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Look, I know how close you were with Mom. I can’t even imagine how hard that must have been for you. And after what happened with Charlotte --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Erin...

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: My point is, try and see this as an opportunity. A chance to put all that negativity behind you and start fresh. You can build a whole new life for yourself. The life you always wanted.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I don’t know what life I want.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. It’ll come to you. Ingrid says nothing. Erin takes her cue and exits, leavin behind a BANK FOLDER with Ingrid’s name on it. Ingrid buries her face in a pillow and SCREAMS. She lies there for a moment, then tosses the pillow aside, pulling her phone and powering it on. The warm glow of the screen lights up her face as she stares at it longingly. ON THE SCREEN - She opens Instagram and searches @badcharlotte. Charlotte’s profile appears with a message “This User Is Private.” Ingrid sighs. She lies back on the bed, listening to the muffled family sounds downstairs, feeling empty and alone  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: A series of items being scanned -- an at-home facial kit, a bag of gummy worms, the latest issue of Vanity Fai six-pack of Corona, a bottle of prescription pills... Ingrid stands at the pharmacy counter with her earbuds in listening to an audiobook while a PHARMACIST rings her up

dialogues.speaker: MELODY BEATTIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Maybe our pain is showing us we need to set a boundary. Maybe it’s showing us we’re going in a wrong direction... Ingrid looks up to see two of CHARLOTTE’S FRIENDS (JENNY NICOLE) walking past. They make knowing eye contact with Ingrid, who quickly turns the other way. The pharmacist hands Ingrid a plastic bag. She grabs it, throwing down cash and making a beeline for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: MELODY BEATTIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s okay to feel hurt; it’s okay to cry; it’s okay to heal; it’s okay to move on to the next feeling, when it’s time... Ingrid is almost to the door when she sees Jenny and Nico rounding the corner right in front of her. Ingrid hides behind a cardboard display filled with candy. We HOLD on Ingrid’s face as she waits for them to pass, removing her earbuds so she can hear them whispering --

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- what is up with her hair?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Seriously. Who’s your stylist? Helen Keller? They laugh. Ingrid touches her hair self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Didn't they send her to an insane asylum?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yep. Her sister told everyone she was at a yoga retreat.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So dark.  11. They disappear around a corner. Ingrid puts her earbuds b in and heads for the exit, trying not to show any emotion

dialogues.speaker: MELODY BEATTIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today, I will not strike out at those who cause me pain. TI will feel my emotions and take responsibility for them... I/E. NICOLE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER A popsicle stick picture frame with a photo of Nicole and family dangles from the rearview mirror. We RACK FOCUS to Ingrid through the windshield as she exi the drugstore, recognizing Nicole's car.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Ingrid makes sure no one is watching, then reaches into h purse and pulls out Erin’s CAR KEY. She drags the key alo the length of Nicole’s car, leaving a jagged white scratc I/E. ERIN’S SUV - EVENING Ingrid is parked in a suburban housing development, eatin gummy worms and staring out the window. HER POV - A brand-new two-story home. Charlotte and her husband exit, carrying a wrapped gift and a bottle of win As they get into their car, Charlotte glances over at us Ingrid ducks down. She peers over the steering wheel. HER POV - Charlotte is squinting in our direction. She whispers to her husband, who looks over at us, alarmed. Ingrid throws the car into reverse, knocking over a garba bin. She jams on the gas and peels off, tires squealing. INT. BATHROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ingrid is lying in the bathtub, drinking a Corona, wearin green face mask and flipping through her copy of Vanity F She pauses on an article featuring a photo of a confident bohemian-looking young woman in faded overalls sitting cr legged on her front porch. The headline reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the photo of TAYLOR SLOANE, 29. Her elegant beau is offset by an effortless style and laid-back warmth. CLOSE on Ingrid’s face. Something inside her has shifted. She is transfixed. Who is this perfect-looking creature? INT. NURSERY - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - MINUTES LATER Ingrid is in bed with her phone and a towel around her he ON THE SCREEN - She types the name “Taylor Sloane” into t Instagram search bar. Her handle pops up - @welltaylored. Ingrid opens Taylor's profile. She has 267K followers.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Whoa. She taps on Taylor’s most recent PHOTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHOTO of Taylor on a beach in Malibu, wearing a haltern swimsuit and covering her face with her hands --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Live in the sunshine, swim in the sea, drink the wild air.” Ralph Waldo Emerson. A SLOW-MO VIDEO of her dog, ROTHKO, hanging out the windo an old Mercedes, tongue flapping, speeding through L.A. -

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My muse. Hashtag Rothko The Dog. A PHOTO of the sun setting over a perfectly-restored dese cabin in Joshua Tree --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There is science, logic and reason. And then there is... California. A VIDEO of a TALL HANDSOME GUY with long ombre hair (EZRA setting off bottle rockets on a rooftop in Downtown L.A.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Baby, you’re a firework. American Flag emoji.  13. A PHOTO of Taylor and Ezra wearing Jean-Luc Godard-inspir Halloween costumes --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Pierrot Le Fou? Oui. We see perfectly-composed PHOTOS of Los Angeles, Joshua T vintage cars, flower arrangements, whimsically-patterned wallpaper, Navajo rugs, designer shoes, artisanal cocktai restaurants, music festivals, travel, travel, more TRAVEL We see VIDEOS of Taylor showing off her house, riding aro Venice on a beach cruiser, being interviewed for Vanity F

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A VIDEO of Taylor on her wedding day in Big Sur. She stan at the altar wearing a 1930s lace dress and flower crown across from Ezra who wears a white tux and black felt hat

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: .-. You may now kiss the bride. Taylor and Ezra kiss. It’s an incredibly intimate moment. INT. BATHROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - EARLY MORNING Ingrid is watching the video in bed, wiping away tears. ECU: Her thumb presses the ‘Follow’ button. INT. LIVING ROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid and Logan are on the couch in their pajamas watchi cartoons while Erin makes dinner in the background. Ingri scrolls through Taylor’s Instagram on her phone. ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of an enchilada on top of a plate emblazoned with the phrase “What are you grateful for?” -

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I Am Grateful for this vegan enchilada with raw cacao mole sauce. Praying hands emoji. Ingrid taps on the ‘Comment’ bubble, thinking of what to We hear INGRID’S VOICE as she types --  14.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Damn, girl! That looks yummy. What’s your email address? Ingrid pauses. Something doesn’t feel right. She deletes her comment and tries again.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am SUCH a foodie. Should we be best friends? Ingrid frowns. Still not right. She tries again.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: OMG! Where is this place?? She adds a ‘Licking Lips’ emoji to the end of her comment Ingrid smiles. Nailed it. She presses SEND. Keith enters from the garage, taking off his cop helmet, serious look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Hey, Ingrid, can I talk to you for a second? In private? Ingrid freezes, looking worried.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ingrid and Keith are standing in the hallway, whispering.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you stop by Charlotte’s house yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Ingrid. Don’t lie to me.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m not lying.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Should I get Erin in here? Maybe you'd feel more comfortable telling her what happened. Erin appears in the doorway, drying her hands with a towe  15.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I got a call from Charlotte’s lawyer this morning. Apparently she saw Ingrid lurking outside her house last night.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (defensive) I wasn’t lurking. I was just feeling low and I wanted to see if she got my letter --

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You sent her a letter?!

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Ingrid, why would you do that?!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I needed to apologize and let her know there were no hard feelings.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: What do you mean no hard feelings?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I mean, none of this would’ve happened if she’d just invited me to her wedding in the first place. Keith and Erin stare at Ingrid, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Ingrid, Charlotte didn’t invite you because you’re not her friend. She's just a girl we went to high school with who reached out to you after Mom died. That’s it!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, okay? It won’t happen again.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: That is such bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Babe, calm down --  16.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: No, I can’t do this anymore. (to Ingrid) It’s clear you don’t want our help so you know what? I’m done. Do whatever you want. This is your problem, not ours. Erin storms off. Keith gives Ingrid one last disapproving glance and exits. Ingrid stands there, looking hurt. INT. BATHROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ingrid is sitting on the toilet, crying softly to herself Her phone BUZZES. She looks down. A new notification. ON THE SCREEN - Taylor has responded to Ingrid’s comment.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cafe Gratitude. It’s the best. Come check it out next time you’re in L.A.! Winking face emoji.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid’s expression changes. She smiles, wiping away tear INT. NURSERY - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ingrid is staring at the Vanity Fair profile of Taylor. HER POV - The caption beneath the photo reads “Taylor and dog, Rothko, at home in Venice, California.” PUNCH IN on the words: “Venice, California."

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Ingrid opens the bank folder Erin left her and checks her account balance sheet. We scroll down a page filled with useless financial jargon until we land on -- “AVAILABLE BALANCE: $91,234.21” Ingrid stares at the number in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid watches, mesmerized, as $100 bills are spit out of counting machine and arranged into neat piles by a BRANCH MANAGER. One by one, Ingrid places the stacks of money in her old L.L. Bean backpack.  17. EXT. ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT The house is asleep. A window opens on the top floor and Ingrid’s backpack is tossed out onto the lawn followed by duffel bag. Ingrid climbs out, carefully lowering herself the ground. She grabs her bags and runs to a waiting CAB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pacific Ocean shimmers under a pink and orange sky, w crashing against the shoreline. We PULL BACK to reveal Ingrid sitting in the sand with he bags, staring out at the sea. She looks down at her phone ON THE SCREEN - Ingrid is creating a new Instagram accoun The cursor blinks in the empty ‘Username’ field. She thin for a moment, then types in the words:

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ingrid Goes West. Her new profile POPS UP. A completely blank canvas. Ingrid raises her phone, snapping a picture of the sunris She pauses, thinking of the perfect caption. She glances around, her eyes landing on a CORONA AD plast to the side of a nearby building, then types:

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Finally found my beach. Happy face emoji. ECU: Ingrid’s thumb presses the ‘Share’ button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS of Ingrid pedaling a brand-new beach cruiser through the streets of Venice, soaking it all in. She pauses in front of an old Victorian house. There is a brand-new black pick-up truck parked out front with a Bat symbol in place of the Toyota emblem. A sign posted in th yard reads: “AVAILABLE: 1 BR + 1 BATH"  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid looks around while the owner, DAN PINTO, 34, rides two-wheeled scooter around, talking on his phone and puff on a vape pen. He wears a flat-brim hat, an XXL Jordan Bu jersey, board shorts and Adidas slides with tube socks.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (into phone) Last night was haywire, dude. You see that girl I was talking to? Total smoke show. Bounced her back to my place for some YouTube and chill. We were up all night. Pinto glances over at Ingrid, clearly saying this for her benefit, but she isn’t paying attention at all.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nah, we didn’t hook up, but it’s all good. I’m juggling too many bitches right now anyway. Gotta whittle down my body count -- Ingrid clears her throat. Pinto lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey listen, I gotta run but hit me up later if you wanna blaze. (awkward beat) Okay, yeah, no worries. Maybe some other time -- (beat) Hello...? Jeremy? Pinto hangs up and turns to Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bad connection. (extends his hand) Hey. Dan Pinto.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ingrid. (confused beat) Are you the landlord?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I don’t really like the term landlord. Just think of me as the chill guy who lives next door and collects rent every month.  19.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: But... this is your place, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: It’s really more of a side hustle to keep me cash-positive while I pursue my true passion. Pinto hands her a card that reads “DAN PINTO // SCREENWRI in Batman Forever font with all of his social media handl

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You write movies? Pinto nods, exhaling a thick cloud of smoke from his vape

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything I’ve seen?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: You familiar with Batman?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Wow. You wrote that?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Not exactly. But I am working on a script for a new installment in the franchise. It ain’t exactly “authorized” but my producer Jeremy used to be Joel Schumacher’s assistant and he pretty much guaranteed he'd forward it along once I finish this new draft. Ingrid has already stopped listening and is making her wa into the bedroom. Pinto chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: How much is this place?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: All business, huh? C’mon, Ingrid. (Dr. Evil voice) Throw me a frickin’ bone here! Pinto grins, expecting a laugh. Ingrid looks uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat) It’s, uh, twenty-nine hundred a month plus two month’s security deposit. No pets allowed but we are most certainly 420-friendly.  Pinto offers Ingrid a hit of his vape pen. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Very cool. I'’11 just run a quick credit check and I’1l also need some proof of income --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Can I pay you in cash? Pinto seems impressed and a little turned on. INT. PINTO’S HOUSE - DAY 20. The place is a glorified dorm room filled with wall-to-wa Batman merchandise, framed posters of classic 90s movies “The Matrix” and “12 Monkeys” and a giant fish tank. Pinto watches as Ingrid digs through her backpack, counti out nine grand in cash on a table littered with weed jars

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Don’t take this the wrong way, but... are you a prostitute?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Drug dealer? (no response) ‘Cause if you were, my producer Jeremy has a legit hook-up --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m not a drug dealer, okay? My mom died and she left me some money and I just want to start over. Pinto takes a solemn drag on his vape pen. Ingrid hands him the cash.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: My condolences.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Thanks. He smiles, handing her the keys.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Welcome to La La Land, Ingrid. (pause) So, uh... what are your plans the rest of the day? Wanna grab some In & Out animal-style? My treat.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m pretty tired but thanks anyway. Ingrid heads for the door. Pinto calls out after her.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: If you need help moving, lemme know and I’1l fire up the Batmobile.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Okay! Will do. Ingrid exits quickly, the screen door slamming behind her

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Peace out, roomie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid stands inside her empty apartment, looking around contentedly. Her phone DINGS. A new notification POPS UP: “@officialdanpinto is now following you.” Ingrid opens Pinto’s profile. A measly 178 followers. She taps on his most recent post. ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of Pinto at Six Flags, crouching throwing up double peace signs in front of BATMAN: THE RI

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Six Flags solo mission. Shit just got real. Ingrid frowns. She opens Taylor's page instead, pulling u her vegan enchilada photo. She taps on the geotag for “Ca Gratitude” and a MAP appears showing the exact location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid sits at a table alone. She cranes her neck, lookin around for any sign of Taylor.  22.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s your biggest emotional wound? Ingrid turns. A WAITRESS with a nose ring is smiling at h

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: That’s our question of the day. She points to a chalkboard hanging on the wall that reads “Today’s Question: What is your biggest emotional wound?” WAITRESS (CONT’D) Mine’s my relationship with my dad. It’s cool if you don’t want to answer. We have to ask everyone who comes in. Company policy.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Uh... I’m good, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: In that case, welcome to Gratitude! My name’s Eden. How can I nourish you today?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m meeting a friend of mine for lunch. Have you seen her? Ingrid holds up a PHOTO of Taylor on her phone that’s bee cropped to look like an original.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Taylor Sloane? Yeah, she comes in all the time. She was just here like an hour ago. (confused) You say you’re meeting her for lunch?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... shoot. I must have gotten the time wrong. (quick beat) Do you remember what she ordered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid sits in front of a plate of yam cauliflower samosa concentrating as she takes a birds-eye PHOTO of it. ON THE SCREEN - Ingrid posts the photo on her Instagram account. We HEAR her voice as she types out the caption:

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, I made it. Thanks for the rec @welltaylored! Hashtag I Am Grateful. Ingrid taps ‘Share’ and smiles, feeling good about hersel Ingrid sets down her phone to take her first bite. She immediately gags, spitting the half-chewed food onto her plate, drawing stares from some of the other customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid sits cross-legged on the floor of her empty apartm eating an In-N-Out burger and looking at Instagram. ON THE SCREEN - A street-style PHOTO of Taylor in front o row of surfboards, wearing a linen sack dress, suede boot and a straw hat, holding a Claire Vivier clutch.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: New @stevenalan threads got me like... Princess emoji.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid walks out wearing the exact same outfit as Taylor carrying two shopping bags. She looks down at her phone. ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of Taylor getting a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Summer chop courtesy of the lovely ladies @trimsalon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid sits in a chair, scrolling through her phone, as t stylist applies highlights to her hair with bits of tin f ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of a first edition of Joan Didion The White Album framed next to an Intelligentsia coffee c  24.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “We tell ourselves stories in order to live.” Joan Didion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is at the coffee bar, hair styled exactly like Taylor's, sipping a latte and reading a first edition of White Album. Her phone DINGS. A notification POPS UP: “@officialdanpinto has commented on your post.” ON THE SCREEN - Ingrid swipes on the notification. Her PH from Cafe Gratitude appears, now with one like from Pinto

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cauliflower samosa game on fleek. Devil Horns emoji. Ingrid sighs, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is wearing sweats and flip-flops, her hair in a me bun, grabbing a sixer of Coronas out of the fridge. As th door closes, she hears a familiar voice and turns to see

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR SLOANE
dialogues.text: -- standing at the register, buying a New York Times and making small talk with the CASHIER.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: -+. I love the feel of ink on paper. It’s so tactile. Ingrid turns back around, trying not to freak out. She pu out her phone and uses the front-facing camera to check h appearance then immediately closes it, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Okay. Relax. Just be cool. (cheerful voice) Hey! How are you?! I’m a huge fan! Fuck... (beat) Oh my god! Hi! It’s me! Ingrid! No! Shut up! Just be yourself... A MOM pushing a stroller comes around the corner. She see Ingrid standing there with her eyes closed, muttering to herself, and immediately turns the other way.  25. Ingrid takes a deep breath and turns, opening her eyes. A she looks at the counter, her expression changes. HER POV - Taylor is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid rushes out of the store looking both ways. HER POV - We PAN AROUND frantically then ZOOM IN on Taylo across the street, walking into a store. Ingrid is about to cross the street when Pinto cruises by his pick-up truck, grinning, music thumping.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: ‘Sup, Ingrid! Ingrid tries to see past Pinto’s truck, but it’s too big.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Get out of the way! Pinto watches, confused, as Ingrid dashes across the busy intersection, cars honking as she runs past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale Venice boutique. Taylor is browsing a table of knickknacks. Ingrid walks up, eyeing Taylor and pretendin to flip through a coffee table book about bread.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Mmmm. This looks so bread. Ingrid winces, realizing her mistake. Taylor looks up.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I mean good. This bread looks so good. (awkward) Sounds like somebody didn’t have their coffee this morning! Ingrid forces a laugh. Taylor smiles politely and looks away. Ingrid remains frozen, a grin plastered on her face

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I'll buy this.  26. Taylor pretends not to hear her. Ingrid approaches the register, glancing back at Taylor longingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor is walking with her earbuds plugged in, scrolling through her phone. In the background, we see Ingrid following her at a safe distance. EXT. TAYLOR’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Taylor opens the gate of her beautiful Craftsman house, checking the mail. There is an Airstream and a vintage Mercedes in the driveway. A dog YAPS from inside. Ingrid hides behind a parked car, watching Taylor as she enters her house. Ingrid pauses, noticing something. HER POV - Taylor’s dog, ROTHKO, sits at the window, panti EXT. TAYLOR’S HOUSE - NIGHT Taylor exits, followed by her husband, EZRA O'KEEFE, 33, sporting an impressive beard. They hop into Taylor's Mercedes and she backs out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches them from the shadows of a nearby alleyway, holding an In-N-Out bag and sucking on a milkshake. Ingrid tip-toes up to the gate, looking both ways. Rothko appears at the window, BARKING incessantly. Ingrid crouch low, hurrying around the side of the house. She tries one the windows. Locked. Then another. Also locked. Ingrid continues around to the back of the house, trying every window until finally one OPENS revealing a small po room. Ingrid tries climbing inside but it’s too small.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Rothko comes sprinting up to the window with his teeth ba Ingrid pulls out a loose hamburger patty, holding it up.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Here! Want some? Rothko stops barking and sits, eyes trained on the patty. Ingrid dangles the meat inside the window, just out of hi reach. Rothko JUMPS up and down, trying to get at it.  27.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Rothko. Come on, boy... Ingrid grabs Rothko mid-jump, pulling him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Rothko’s face, barking incessantly. Ingrid stands above him, desperately trying to placate hi

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (hissing) Shh! Please stop barking! There’s a KNOCK at the front door. Ingrid looks startled. She grabs Rothko, looking around frantically, placing him the cabinet under the sink. She tosses an already-opened of Flamin’ Hot Cheetos inside and shuts the cabinet door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The front door opens, revealing Pinto.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Hey, sorry to bug you, but... did you by any chance get a dog? Ingrid stares at Pinto blankly.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Oh... Really? Maybe it’s the kush talking but I swear I heard barking coming from your place.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I was watching a movie. About dogs.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Like Beethoven?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yes! Beethoven! Love that movie.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: What! Me too! Wanna finish it at my place? We can take my new bubbler for a test drive.  28. Before Ingrid can respond, Rothko wanders into the living room with orange dust all over his face, violently rippin apart the Cheetos bag. Pinto gives Ingrid a look.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: My friend asked if I could dog-sit for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Yeahhhh. Unfortunately, it’s kind of a “no dog” situation up in here.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Totally. It’s not my dog though.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Right. The thing is, I’m actually super allergic to pet dander. One whiff of that guy and I could go into anaphylactic shock.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: It’s only for one night. He won't come near you, I promise. (pouty face) Please? Pinto looks at Rothko, then back at Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Well I guess I can let it slide this one time.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dan. You’re the best. Pinto goes to leave, then quickly turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way, I’m putting together a little table read for my script this weekend and I'd love to have you in the mix.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (winces ) Ooh, this weekend? I don’t think I can.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: You sure? There’s free sushi.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, no. Sorry.  29. Awkward beat. Pinto is disappointed but plays it off.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Hey, all good. More sushi for me, right? Pinto grins, lingering in the doorway. Ingrid raises her eyebrows, indicating the conversation is over. He takes a step back and she closes the door, heaving a sigh of reli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: A “MISSING DOG” poster with an artfully-shot photo o Rothko from Taylor’s Instagram is tacked to a telephone p REVEAL Ingrid staring at the poster. She rips it down and slips it into her purse, walking away quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is on the phone, holding the MISSING DOG poster.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello? Ingrid freezes. She wasn’t expecting a man’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Um, hi... I’m calling about your dog? I saw your poster --

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Rothko! Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s totally fine. Rothko is lying on the floor, chest heaving, surrounded b empty fast-food wrappers and Cheetos bags.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where do you live? I’11 come by right now. Ingrid looks around the empty apartment.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m... stuck in traffic. Why don’t I swing by your place in, like, twenty minutes?  30.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Great! See you then.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (confused) Don’t you need the address? Ingrid silently curses at herself for being so careless.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yep. Ready when you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS of Ingrid styling her hair, putting on make-u slipping into a brand-new Rachel Comey dress... EXT. TAYLOR’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid walks up to the front gate with Rothko in one arm her Claire Vivier clutch in the other. The door opens to reveal Taylor, wearing an embroidered w Mexican peasant dress and Birkenstock sandals.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Rothko! We missed you! Rothko leaps out of Ingrid’s arms and runs to Taylor. Ezr appears behind her, wearing a chambray apron covered in p splatters. He leans over, letting Rothko lick his mouth. TAYLOR (CONT’D) Oh my god, thank you! We were so worried. You have no idea. (extends her hand) Hi. I’m Taylor. CLOSE on Taylor's perfectly-manicured hand. Ingrid stares it. She’s been waiting for this moment. Their hands touch

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: This is my husband, Ezra.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Hola. Where’d you find him?  31.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, just... a few blocks from here. Ezra inspects Rothko’s eyes, looking concerned.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: He looks sick. Must have been eating garbage or something.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Poor Rothko. (to Ingrid) Hang on, before I forget... Taylor reaches into her Clare Vivier clutch and pulls out checkbook. Ezra notices Ingrid’s matching bag and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys have the same purse.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (feigning surprise) Oh my God. So random.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Should I make it out to cash?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, I can’t take your money.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We insist.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m just glad he’s okay. Really.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Why don’t you stay for dinner? Let us cook for you.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yes! I love that idea. SLOW PUSH IN on Ingrid. She is freaking out on the inside but trying to play it cool...  32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor and Ezra lead Ingrid through their house. It’s eve more perfect in real life -- Midcentury modern furniture, color-coordinated bookshelves, macrame plant hangers, Moroccan rugs, and tons of natural light.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Can we get you something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’d love a Corona. Taylor laughs. Ingrid joins in on a slight delay.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I think we can do better than that.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Taylor makes a killer South Side.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It’s the same recipe they use at the 21 Club in Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (so confused) Um... sure. INT. KITCHEN - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid watches as Taylor pours freshly-made cocktails int copper mugs, adding muddled lime and a sprig of mint.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Sorry, we've been so stressed about Rothko that I haven’t had a chance to run to the farmer’s market. Ingrid looks over at Ezra, searing a fresh piece of tuna a blowtorch. He places the wilted dandelion greens atop t plate of seared tuna using a pair of tweezers.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Hope you don’t mind if we improvise a little. Ingrid seems slightly intimidated by how nice everything

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m at a restaurant. Taylor smiles, handing the finished drink to Ingrid.  33.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: More like Kitchen Nightmares. Ingrid takes a sip. It’s the best drink she’s ever tasted

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Holy shit. This is amazing. Taylor stares at Ingrid with a flicker of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Have we met before?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (nervous ) No. Definitely not.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Huh. Your face looks so familiar. Awkward silence. Ingrid is desperate to change the subjec

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You mind if I use your bathroom? INT. HALLWAY - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid wanders down the hallway towards the bathroom. She pauses, eyeing a cluster of photos on the wall. Each is of Taylor and Ezra in a different desirable location - a beach in Tulum, standing atop Machu Picchu, eating sush with Jiro, wearing costumes at Burning Man... Ingrid leans in closer, noticing a graduation photo of Ta and her brother, NICKY, a handsome puckish young dude. Ingrid notices an open door. She peers through the crack. HER POV - A bright, minimalist bedroom with a few art pie on the walls and even more books and plants. Ingrid scans the room like a Terminator, taking note of every detail. INT. BATHROOM - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid turns the faucet on full blast. She throws back th shower curtain, opens the medicine cabinet and digs throu the trash can, snapping pictures with her phone. Perfume, shampoo, make-up, candles, feminine hygiene products --  34. INT. KITCHEN - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Ingrid sits back down. Taylor snaps her finger, realizing

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I know where I saw you! (off Ingrid’s look) The Echo Park Craft Fair! You were selling those Bolivian clay pots.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I actually just moved here a week ago.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Maybe you’re confusing her with one of your crazy internet fan-girls. Ingrid tenses up. Taylor touches her arm, reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: He’s giving me shit because I happen to engage with people on social media like the rest of the known universe. My husband suffers from chronic technophobia.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: That’s not true. I just don’t want someone forming an opinion of me based on what kind of shoes I wear or what I ate for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (teasing) Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: No, wait a second. Let’s ask Ingrid what she thinks. Taylor and Ezra both shift their attention to Ingrid. She pauses, choosing her words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I think you can tell a lot about a person based on what they like.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yes! Thank you. I mean, in an ideal world we wouldn’t all be so judgmental but we can’t help ourselves, so why pretend otherwise? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Ingrid) Like with you. I knew I'd like you the moment I saw you just based on what you were wearing. Ingrid smiles, pleased with herself. Ezra shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: I prefer to keep some parts of my life private, that’s all. I want my work to speak for itself.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (proudly) Ezra’s an artist.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What kind of stuff do you do? INT. GARAGE - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - NIGHT A three-shot of Ingrid standing between Taylor and Ezra, staring thoughtfully at a painting out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: I guess you could label it “pop art” but I’m not sure yet. REVERSE SHOT of a wall of canvases featuring Ed Ruscha-st paintings of popular phrases like “CURRENT MOOD” and “ON FLEEK” and “I CAN'T EVEN” over classic American landscape

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I love this. Taylor smiles at Ezra, squeezing his arm encouragingly.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are any of these for sale?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Uh... I mean, not technically --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Yes. Of course they are. Ingrid approaches a painting that reads “SQUAD GOALS” ove image of wild horses galloping through a field.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: How much is this one?  36. Ezra looks to Taylor for guidance.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: How much did we say “Squad Goals” was, babe?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I think it was twelve hundred? Taylor and Ezra watch as Ingrid reaches into her clutch a pulls out a wallet filled with CASH. She counts out twelv hundred dollars and hands it to a stunned Ezra. TAYLOR (CONT’D) (smiles) I’ll grab the champagne. EXT. BACKYARD - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ezra is filling Taylor and Ingrid’s glasses with champagn

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: To Ingrid. Rescuer of dogs, patron of the arts, and all around good neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Salut! They all cheers. Ingrid blushes, smiling as she takes a s

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS of Ingrid, Taylor and Ezra hanging out, tal and laughing, sipping cocktails and smoking cigarettes. F the first time, Ingrid feels like she’s where she belongs EXT. FRONT PORCH - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - LATER It's late. Taylor and Ezra are saying goodbye to Ingrid, is carrying Ezra’s enormous painting with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: So great meeting you, Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too. Ingrid lingers for a moment, not wanting to leave... Taylor’s phone BUZZES. She looks at it, frowning.  37.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh, you’ve got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Ahna cancelled on me again. I can’t even deal with her right now. Ezra rubs Taylor’s back, consoling her.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Babe, don’t worry. We'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (concerned) Is everything okay? Taylor sighs, gesturing to the AIRSTREAM in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We bought that monstrosity at an estate sale and I’ve been trying to move it out to our place in Joshua Tree but my old Mercedes can’t tow it. My friend has a truck but she keeps flaking on me --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (blurting out) I have a truck. Taylor and Ezra look at Ingrid, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh, no... I couldn’t. You’ve done so much for us already.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No, really. I don’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Great. Problem solved. Taylor gives Ezra a look, feeling put on the spot. Ingrid picks up on this, adding:

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I was actually thinking of going out there soon anyway. I don’t really know anyone here yet and you both seem like nice people.  38. BEAT. Taylor smiles, warming to the idea.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay, yeah. How’s this Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Perfect!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Here, I’1l give you my number. Ingrid hands Taylor her phone. She watches as Taylor punc in her info, struggling to contain her excitement. EXT. PINTO’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid knocks on the door. It opens, revealing a shirtles and sweaty Pinto. He looks completely caught off-guard.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Ingrid! Hey. Sorry, you caught me in the middle of a workout sesh -- We HEAR the unmistakable sounds of porn emanating from hi laptop. Pinto exits quickly, shutting the door behind him

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Is this a bad time?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Nope. All good. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (wincing) Can I borrow your truck?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: The Batmobile? Sure thing. Where we headed? Ikea? Home Depot?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I actually need it this Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Ooh, sorry, Ingrid. No can do. Got my big table read that night.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Is there any way I could borrow it during the day? Without you? Pinto laughs, then realizes Ingrid isn’t joking.  39.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Are you for real?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Please? I’11 do anything. Pinto pauses to consider this, stroking his chin.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Well, now that you mention it, one of my actresses booked a Nickelodeon show so we’re looking for someone to fill in as Catwoman. (grins) Whaddya say, Ingrid? You ready for your close-up? We HOLD on Ingrid as she swallows uncomfortably... EXT. PINTO’S HOUSE - DAY Pinto is leading Ingrid around his pick-up, all business.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No texting and driving. No smoking. Premium fuel only. Oh, and there’s a little blind spot on the passenger side. You’re not gonna be towing anything, are you?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Her engine’s been supercharged so she'll overheat if she’s pulling too much weight. Guess that’s the trade-off you gotta make if you wanna burn rubber, am I right? Pinto laughs. Ingrid laughs with a slight delay.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, that concludes the tutorial. Just be back here by five on Saturday and we'll cruise to Jeremy’s dad’s house for the read.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Dan, thank you so much.  40.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No worries, Ingrid. Or should I say... Catwoman?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ingrid’s fine for now. Pinto puts his arm around her in a friendly but awkward w

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: It’s funny. I always said I'd never let anyone else drive the Batmobile, but... I have a good feeling about you, Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinto’s truck flies down the highway with Ingrid behind t wheel and the Airstream hitched to the back. She attempts change lanes and narrowly misses a HONKING SEDAN. I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK (MOVING) - DAY Ingrid drives with both hands gripping the wheel, looking stressed out. Taylor rides shotgun, scrolling through her Instagram mentions and firing off replies.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you've never been to Joshua Tree. We should swing by the Integratron for a sound bath. Ingrid nods, confused. Taylor pulls out a CD case from th center console, holding up the Batman Forever soundtrack. TAYLOR (CONT’D) Wow. I had no idea you were so into Batman. Ingrid laughs uncomfortably. Taylor pops in the CD. TAYLOR (CONT’D) You would love my brother. He was obsessed with this movie when we were kids.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You have a brother?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Nicky. We’re twins, actually. He’s the best. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s so funny and, like, genius- level smart. I keep telling him to move out here but he and Ezra don’t really get along.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Nicky used to be a bit of a party animal. He had a few brushes with the law but he’s totally sober now. A loud CHIME sounds from inside the truck. A RED EMERGENC LIGHT flashes on the dashboard. TAYLOR (CONT’D) Yikes. Should we pull over? Ingrid checks the time on her phone. It’s past noon alrea

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m sure it’s nothing. Ingrid turns up the music but the CHIME is still audible.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It sounds pretty serious. I/’1l check the manual. Taylor pops open the glove and a bunch of crap tumbles ou including a box of MAGNUM CONDOMS and a baggie of COCAINE

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Ingrid!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh no, those aren’t mine. Taylor picks up the vehicle registration, reading aloud.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Who's “Daniel Pinto”? We HOLD on Ingrid’s face as she thinks of what to say -- EXT. ROY’S MOTEL & CAFE - DAY Ingrid and Taylor are sitting underneath the iconic sign while a MECHANIC works on Pinto’s truck in the background  42.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me you had a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: It’s not serious or anything.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: How long have you guys been dating?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: A little over a week?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: And he’s already letting you borrow his truck? Wow, you move fast. The mechanic approaches, wiping grease off on his coveral

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Car's good to go, ladies. Just needed to cool down a bit.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh my God, thank you. You’re the best. Would you mind snapping a quick picture of us before we go? Ingrid’s heart skips a beat. Taylor hands the mechanic he phone and stands next to Ingrid while he lines up the sho

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Say cheese. Ingrid smiles wide. Taylor touches her arm, whispering.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Don’t smile. Here. Put these on. Taylor gives Ingrid her sunglasses. Ingrid puts them on, smile vanishing. They pose while the mechanic snaps a few

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Okay, I think we got it. He hands Taylor back her phone. She swipes through the pictures and frowns, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Sorry, but would you mind taking a few more? This time, try framing it with the two of us in the middle and the sign right above our heads.  43. She hands her phone back to the puzzled mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Um... sure. Taylor tries out a series of different poses as the mecha steps back and continues snapping, growing impatient.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (to Ingrid) Should we do one with a peace sign?

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Last one! Taylor flashes a peace sign. Ingrid flashes one too. CLIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picturesque 1950s-era homestead cabin surrounded by cac and desert flowers. The Airstream is parked out front. Ingrid and Taylor wander around the property, enjoying th outdoors and sipping fresh-squeezed lemonade from mason j

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: This is heaven.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You should've seen it when we moved in. It was vile. The inside smelled like cat urine and the roof was caving in. Ezra and I did all the renovations ourselves. Ingrid nods, impressed. Her phone DINGS. ON THE SCREEN - A text from Pinto: “Yoooo! Where u at?”

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Should we head back?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Are you crazy? We just got here. Taylor turns to Ingrid with a mischievous smile.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK - EVENING ECU: A fingernail with a tiny palm tree painted on it dip into the baggie of cocaine. The truck is parked outside a desert bar called PAPPY & HARRIET’S. Ingrid watches Taylor do a lady-like bump off nail, tipping her head back to sniff the drip like a pro.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Do you do this a lot?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Not anymore. I went through a brief coke phase in college but I haven't done any since Burning Man. I know Ezra and I may seem like a couple of old fogies but we still know how to cut loose every once in a while. Have you been to Burning Man? You should totally join our camp next year. Taylor rubs her gums as she passes Ingrid the bag of coke TAYLOR (CONT’D) I’m so glad we came here, by the way. Pappy’s is the best. The crowd's a bit sketchy but they always have great live music and the most amazing desert vibes -- Ingrid’s phone DINGS repeatedly from inside her bag. TAYLOR (CONT’D) Um, is everything okay? Ingrid reaches into her bag and subtly checks her phone. ON THE SCREEN - Ingrid’s has 13 MISSED CALLS from Pinto a series of frantic text messages: “Is everything OK Ingrid “Why aren’t u answering ur phone                        !

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Just Dan checking up on me.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That is so sweet. Ezra never texts me when I’m out of town. His communication skills are atrocious. Ingrid’s phone LIGHTS UP with another call from Pinto.  45. TAYLOR (CONT’D) Come on, let’s dance! Taylor hops out. Ingrid hesitates for a beat, then presse “Decline” and powers her phone OFF. She dips her nail int the bag of blow and accidentally does a HUGE BUMP as we -

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PAPPY & HARRIET’S - NIGHT Ingrid and Taylor are at the bar, toasting margaritas. Taylor holds up her phone, snapping a photo of them toget

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Taylor and Ingrid are on the dance floor. Taylor moves he body with a sexy confidence, while Ingrid shuffles around self-consciously, trying to imitate Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ingrid and Taylor are doing Fireball shots by the pool ta with a group of DRUNK MARINES. Taylor snaps another photo

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ingrid, Taylor and the Marines are all on the dance floor Ingrid is starting to get loose. One of the Marines tries grinding with Taylor but Ingrid wedges herself between th

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ingrid, Taylor and two of the Marines are crammed inside bathroom stall, doing lines. Taylor is talking non-stop while Ingrid nods, hanging on her every word.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The Marines have formed a circle, cheering as Taylor and Ingrid tear up the dance floor. Ingrid lets herself go, h body erupting into a series of bizarre spasms. Taylor follows Ingrid’s lead, allowing her own moves to get bigg and weirder. They jump up and down, sweating and laughing I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK (MOVING) - NIGHT Ingrid and Taylor are tearing down a desert highway, smok cigarettes and singing along to Seal’s “KISS FROM A ROSE” We hear HONKS off screen. The Marines from the bar pull u alongside them in a Jeep, whistling and cat-calling.  46.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Watch this. Taylor lifts her shirt and FLASHES the soldiers her breas TAYLOR (CONT’D) Spring break! Woo! The Marines are cheering and HONKING like crazy. Ingrid turns and lifts her shirt, taking both hands off the whee

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Spring break, bitches! Taylor looks ahead, eyes widening.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Ingrid! Look out! HER POV - A RABBIT is standing in the middle of the road. Ingrid jerks the wheel, swerving sharply onto the shoulde REEEEEEEEEE! The passenger side of the truck SCRAPES loud against the guard rail, sparks flying everywhere... Ingrid SLAMS ON THE BRAKES, all the color draining from h face. She and Taylor exchange a concerned look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinto’s truck is parked in the driveway with a HUGE SCRAT running down the entire passenger side. Taylor and Ingrid are sitting on the porch, wrapped in Na blankets. They pass a joint back and forth, both coming d hard. Ingrid stares at the damaged truck.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Dan is gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Relax. It’s just a scratch. You can buff that right out.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What do I say happened?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Just tell him it was an honest mistake. He’ll understand. Come on, don’t let one little scratch ruin an otherwise perfect night.  47.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you're right. Silence. Taylor takes a thoughtful drag and exhales.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: So... what made you wanna move to

dialogues.speaker: L.A.
dialogues.text: Ingrid stares at Taylor, looking hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, why? How bad can it be?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Try me. Ingrid pauses, taking a long drag. She exhales.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Well, let’s see. My mom died about a year ago, so... that happened. Then my best friend decided not to invite me to her wedding and we had this big falling out. And if that wasn’t enough, my sister sold our mom’s house behind my back while I was still living there. Taylor is staring at Ingrid with a mix of pity and sadnes

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You poor thing. Ingrid pauses, suddenly feeling self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Sorry. Am I being too intense?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No! Not at all. I love how real you are. (beat) Can I tell you a secret?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Um, yes! Hello! Spilling my guts over here...  48. Taylor laughs, easing the tension.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay. See that house over there? Taylor points toward a similar-looking HOUSE next door.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve been thinking about buying it. (beat) I know it sounds crazy, but... I have this idea of opening a boutique hotel filled with all of my favorite things where everything in it is for sale. Ingrid stares at Taylor in stoned amazement.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: That is such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Right? It’s so simple. Basically, if you see something you like, you can take it with you and we'll add it to your bill. It would be like my Instagram but in real life.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Okay. That sounds incredible and you need to do that right now.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm thinking of calling it... Desert D’Or.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: How did you come up with that?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It’s from this Norman Mailer book. The Deer Park. I'm obsessed with it. Promise me you won’t repeat any of this. I haven’t even told Ezra about it yet.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Why not? Taylor takes the joint and drags on it, sighing.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I dunno. Ever since I convinced him to quit his job and become an artist full time he’s been kind of weird about money.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (confused) I thought his paintings were really popular.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh, they are. Don’t get me wrong, he’s absurdly talented but he refuses to self-promote. He thinks it’s phony or something -- (catching herself) God, listen to me rambling on like an insane person. You must think I’m the worst.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? You’re perfect. Taylor laughs, faux-embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. Perfectly fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No, I’m serious. You’re by far the coolest, most interesting person I've ever met. Taylor cocks her head to the side, staring at Ingrid as i she just said something incredibly profound.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Thank you. She leans her head on Ingrid’s shoulder. TAYLOR (CONT’D) You're a good friend, Ingrid. Ingrid’s heart flutters at the word “friend”. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor is passed out on the couch, fast asleep, while Ing lies next to her, wide awake, watching her. She takes out her phone, snapping photo after photo of them together.  50. EXT. TAYLOR’S HOUSE - DAY Pinto’s truck rolls to a stop in front of the house. Tayl gives Ingrid a big warm hug. She pauses before she gets o

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hey, so... about last night.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh no, don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: All that stuff about Ezra --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: My lips are sealed.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Thanks. And tell Dan sorry about the truck. Can’t wait to meet him! Taylor exits. Ingrid’s smile disappears as reality sets i I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK (MOVING) - MINUTES LATER Ingrid pulls onto her block to see a COP CAR parked outsi of Pinto’s house. Pinto is talking anxiously to a pair of COPS, gesticulating wildly and chain-vaping his e-cig. Pinto sees his truck and a look of angry relief washes ov him. He runs over as Ingrid pulls up in front of the hous

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Ingrid! Where the fuck were you?!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. I can explain. Ingrid parks the car and jumps out. Pinto turns to the co

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Sorry, fellas. False alarm. The cops shake their heads and walk back to their car. Pi sticks his head inside the truck, sniffing the air.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Were you smoking in here? I specifically said “No Smoking”!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: My friend might have had, like, one cigarette --  51.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Your friend...?!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: My friend Taylor. I told you she was coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No. You didn’t. Ingrid nervously watches Pinto make his way around the tr

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: So... how was the table read?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Cancelled, obviously. Pinto sees the damage and freezes, lowering his vape pen shock. Ingrid tries to remain upbeat.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You can buff that right out. (no response) It was an honest mistake. (more silence) Don’t worry, I‘’1l pay for it. Pinto leans against the truck with his head down, fightin back tears. He bites his lip, trying to remain gangster.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Anything else I should know about?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Well... we may have found something in the glove box --

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: One thing led to another --

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: You stole my coke too?! The cops, still idling in their car, both look up at Pint

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks again, officers! Pinto angles Ingrid away, leading her back to the house.  52.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to say to you right now, Ingrid. I trusted you.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry! Pinto looks away, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I thought you were Catwoman. Turns out you were Two-Face all along. Pinto storms back to his house, SLAMMING the door behind Ingrid stands there, feeling guilty. DING! She looks down at her phone. A new notification: “@welltaylored has tagged a photo of you.” Ingrid opens her Instagram excitedly. ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of her and Taylor standing under Roy’s Motel & Cafe sign, looking like best friends.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Feet on the ground, head in the sky. Twin Ladies Emoji. ECU: The photo already has 2,487 ‘Likes’ while the COMMEN section is littered with phrases like “Great shot!" and “beauties” and “#squadgoals” and “Inspiring! !" CLOSE on Ingrid as an elated smile spreads across her fac

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dear Erin. MUSIC CUE: MOZART’S “EXSULTATE, JUBILATE, K.165”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS of Ingrid printing out the INSTAGRAM PHOTO of and Taylor, cutting it out and sliding the finished image into a standard-sized photo frame.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're probably wondering what I’ve been up to the last few weeks.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is wearing a brand-new halterneck swimsuit, straw and sunglasses, reading Norman Mailer’s The Deer Park.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, I decided to take your advice and give myself a fresh start in beautiful, sunny Los Angeles. Her phone BUZZES. She lifts her sunglasses, squinting at ON THE SCREEN - A text from Taylor reads: “Gallery openin tonight. Wanna come?” Ingrid replies with a Thumbs Up emo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front window, we see Taylor and Ezra introduc Ingrid to a bunch of hip L.A. people.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: L.A. is the best. I found an amazing house right by the beach and I can’t believe how nice and cool everyone is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is having brunch with Taylor and a group of her girlfriends. Ingrid cracks a joke about their waiter and everyone laughs. She smiles, feeling a little boost.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m making a ton of new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor leads Ingrid through the store, helping her pick o stuff for her apartment. She hands Ingrid a ceramic penda lamp, gushing over how amazing it is. Ingrid waits until Taylor walks away then peeks at the price tag: $1,350.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My friend Taylor’s been helping me explore my creative side, a part of myself I never knew existed.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceramic pendant lamp now hangs from the ceiling. The apartment has been transformed into a miniature version o Taylor's house, with Ezra’s “SQUAD GOALS” painting hangin prominently on the wall amidst books and hanging plants. Ingrid holds up her phone, snapping a photo of her space.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lately, I’ve been getting really into photography. IN QUICK CUTS we see Ingrid add a filter to the photo, po it to Instagram, and watch as it starts racking up ‘Likes

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You should follow me on Instagram. I have almost a thousand followers and I’m adding new ones every day. EXT. PINTO’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid walks up to the front porch, leaving an envelope labeled “INGRID RENT” on the door mat.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I have a boyfriend now too. His name is Dan and he’s an absurdly talented screenwriter. Ingrid walks away, glancing back over her shoulder. HER POV - Pinto is spying on her from a second-floor wind He quickly disappears behind the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s writing the new Batman movie. How cool is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid unzips the L.L. Bean backpack. There is noticeably less cash than before. Ingrid frowns and quickly zips it back up, trying not to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Turns out you were right. All it took was some money and I finally have the life I always wanted.  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: A letter with no return address drops into a mailbox

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: With love, always... Ingrid. Ingrid pedals away on her bike, wearing a light-colored sundress, a bottle of rosé in her front basket. We hear L ROCK MUSIC blasting from an approaching car as -- A red Mustang convertible blows through the stop sign jus Ingrid is crossing the intersection. She swerves, crashin into a row of trash cans and flipping over the handlebars Ingrid sits up just in time to see the driver, a DUDE ina backwards “Make America Great Again” hat, speeding away.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Fucking asshole! EXT. TAYLOR’S HOUSE - LATER Ingrid walks up, flustered, her dress covered in dirt. Sh pauses, noticing the RED MUSTANG parked in the driveway. EXT. BACKYARD - TAYLOR’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Ingrid enters to see Taylor laying out food on a small ta surrounded by floor pillows. Ezra is crouched in the corn flipping through a crate of LPs. Taylor looks up, concern

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Some idiot ran a stop sign and almost killed me. (re: Mustang) Whose car is that in the driveway? The screen door slams 0.S. Ingrid turns to see the DUDE i the Trump hat (NICKY SLOANE, 29) emerge from the house wearing Chubbies shorts and a Patagonia fleece, drinking from the carton. Ingrid freezes, instantly recognizing hi

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: God I love L.A. I just saw two homeless chicks on the street duking it out bumfight-style. Nicky notices Ingrid and stares at her, confused.  56. NICKY (CONT’D) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Nicky, this is Ingrid. Ingrid, this is my brother Nicky. He flew in from Paris this morning without telling us. Nicky nods at Ingrid indifferently.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: ‘Sup. Ingrid flashes Nicky a tight-lipped smile.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: So nice to meet you. How long are you in town for?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Haven't decided yet. I figure at least a few weeks.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: (looking up, alarmed) A few weeks? Taylor smiles, hugging Nicky and leaning on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Best surprise ever.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Brunch is underway. Nicky is dominating the conversation, chain-smoking and drinking La Croix. Taylor is hanging on his every word while Ezra feigns interest. Ingrid glares Nicky, eyes filled with contempt for this unwelcome intru

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: -- so I’m in the Ritz lobby minding my own business, when I happen to strike up a conversation with this Chinese billionaire named Bruno.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (to Ingrid) Nicky and I took Mandarin in college. Nicky says something to Taylor in Mandarin that makes her CRACK UP. Ezra and Ingrid both watch, feeling excluded.  57.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Anyway, next thing I know, we’re at some random wedding with our shirts off, having a push-up contest.
