I’m winning, obviously, when all of a sudden the groom’s dad grabs us from behind and jacks us up by our throats like he’s Darth Vader or some shit. So I decide it’s a good idea to take a swing at him --

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: You were sober during all this?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (raises his right hand) Scout’s honor. Of course the cops show up and everyone scatters. I end up hitching a ride to the airport only to realize I left my credit card at the hotel. So there I am, stranded at De Gaulle with my dick in my hand, when who do I see? Nicky pulls his eyes into two slits. NICKY (CONT’D) Herro, Nicky! Ingrid blanches. Taylor’s smile fades a little. Ezra look like he’s had enough, standing up.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Great story, Nicky. If anyone needs me, I’1l be in my studio. Ezra walks into the garage, the door slamming behind him. Nicky rolls his eyes at Taylor, who says nothing. Ingrid looks between them, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Anyway, this little fucker Bruno is so grateful to me for showing hima good time, he buys me a first class ticket to L.A. I watched twelve hours of Family Guy and got a hand- job from some fashion chick named Harley something or other --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Harley Chung?!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Bingo. That’s the one.  58.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I’m obsessed with Harley. Her stuff is the best. She has, like, over a million followers.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: We're having dinner tomorrow night at the Chateau if you wanna join?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Um, obviously! Ingrid leans forward, sucking air.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Actually, we’re supposed to see Willy Wonka at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery tomorrow. I already bought the tickets, so... Taylor looks crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... that’s right.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hey, no worries. You guys should totally go see a forty year old dogshit kids movie at a cemetery instead. That sounds way more fun. Ingrid blushes, feeling embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Don’t be a prick, Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I was joking! I’m sure you can meet her some other time. Taylor turns to Ingrid with an apologetic smile.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I bail? Nicky and I literally never see each other. But you should absolutely go without me. You can bring Dan!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (deflated) Oh, um... yeah, sure --  59.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (to Taylor) Hey, remember that girl from Andover who looked exactly like Gene Wilder?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh my God, yes! What a weirdo! Taylor and Nicky crack up. Ingrid feels left out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is sitting on her couch, sipping a Corona and scrolling through Instagram when she pauses. ON THE SCREEN - We see a PHOTO of Taylor, Nicky and HARLE CHUNG doing silly poses inside a candy-themed photo booth

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wonka vibes with @harleychung at the Hollywood Cemetery tonight. Ingrid stares at the photo, feeling a torrent of emotions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swarm of people are seated on the lawn with chairs and picnic blankets, eating and drinking. A DJ spins music in front of a giant mausoleum that doubles as a movie screen Ingrid appears, sweaty and out of breath, holding a Navaj blanket. She frantically scans the crowd for Taylor. HER POV - Taylor, Ezra and Nicky are sitting in a VIP SEC filled with pillows, blankets and ATTRACTIVE L.A. PEOPLE.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey guys! They all turn as Ingrid approaches. Taylor looks surprise

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Ingrid! What are you doing here? Ingrid is hurt but tries not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Um... I invited you, remember?  60.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh, right! Turns out Harley knows the guy who runs this and she hooked us up with VIP passes. Ingrid stands there, expectantly, for an awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Is it cool if I sit with you guys?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Yeah, totally. (turning) Harley, this is our friend, Ingrid. Nicky’s date, HARLEY CHUNG, 30s, smiles up at her, lookin like a prettier, more polished version of Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY CHUNG
dialogues.text: Hey. Nice to meet you. Ingrid nods. Nicky peers over at her, smiling mischievous

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What up, Ingrid? Where’s your imaginary boyfriend? Taylor punches Nicky’s arm, whispering.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Stop. (to Ingrid; explaining) We were just talking about how we still haven’t met Dan and Nicky made a joke about him being your imaginary boyfriend. It was dumb. Ingrid forces a laugh, trying to be a good sport about it

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... when can we meet him?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, Dan’s really busy with work stuff right now. He’s a writer --

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (singing) Oompa loompa doopity doo, I lied about my boyfriend to you. Harley laughs. Ingrid’s smile vanishes.  61.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: You should bring him this weekend. Harley's house-sitting this rad place in Malibu. (to Harley) I mean, if there’s room, obviously.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No no, go ahead, Ezra. Invite whoever the fuck you want.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY CHUNG
dialogues.text: (to Ingrid) It’s totally fine. You guys are more than welcome.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (cheery) Great. Sounds fun! Just then, a FRAT GUY stumbles by, accidentally spilling all over Harley’s dress without noticing. She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hey! Watch where you're going, jackoff! The frat guy turns, realizing.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT GUY
dialogues.text: Oh shit. My bad.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You call that an apology?

dialogues.speaker: FRAT GUY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Didn’t see you there. Nicky stands, getting in the guy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Can you see me now?

dialogues.speaker: FRAT GUY
dialogues.text: Dude, relax. It was an accident. Nicky shoves the guy, causing him to stumble backwards.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Didn’t see you there, dude. Taylor quickly pulls Nicky away, holding him back.  62.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you? Are you trying to get arrested right now?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: He started it. A SECURITY GUARD with a clipboard comes lumbering over.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Is there a problem here?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY CHUNG
dialogues.text: No, no, everything’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Can I have everybody’s name please?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY CHUNG
dialogues.text: Harley Chung? (adding) I'm friends with John.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (scanning his list) Okay, you’re good. (to Ingrid) Your name, miss?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ingrid Thorburn? The security guard scans his list, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: I don’t have you on here.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Right, well... I’m not technically on the list but these are my friends, so --

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Sorry, but if you’re not on the list you can’t be here. Ingrid looks to Taylor, who flashes a conciliatory smile.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We'll hang this weekend! I/’11 text you all the info.  63. Ingrid nods, getting the message. Nicky waves ‘bye-bye’ a the security guard escorts her out of the VIP area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screening is underway. Ingrid is sitting alone on the steps of a mausoleum, looking miserable.

dialogues.speaker: WILLY WONKA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes, the danger must be growing, ‘cause the rowers keep on rowing, and they’re certainly not showing any signs that they are slowing! HER POV - Taylor and Harley are sharing a joint while Nic cracks jokes. They all laugh, having a blast without Ingr EXT. PINTO’S HOUSE - DAY Pinto glides up on his two-wheeled scooter, rounding the corner to find Ingrid sitting on his doorstep. He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hi Dan. Silence. Pinto looks past Ingrid, avoiding eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just wanted to say hey.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (long beat) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I brought you something. She produces a box from behind her back and hands it to Pinto. He reluctantly opens it, revealing a mint-conditio Batman Forever varsity bomber jacket. Pinto rolls his eye

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Nice try, Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What? You don’t like it?  64.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Of course I like it. That’s why I bought one off eBay two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Check the front pocket. Pinto finds a JAR OF WEED in the pocket. He shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: This is indica. Everybody knows I only smoke sativa. Besides, a replacement eight-ball would have been more appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Look, I’m trying, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: You did eight grand worth of damage to my car, Ingrid! Try harder!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Fine! You're right! I took advantage of you and I’m really sorry! I just wish we could start over and pretend like none of that stuff ever happened.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (curious) You mean, like a reboot?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Um... Sure. Pinto nods, considering this. He takes a quick vape hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheesy tiki restaurant with bamboo and faux-Polynesian tchotchkes everywhere. Pinto and Ingrid are sitting ina booth wearing matching Batman Forever jackets and sharing Flaming Volcano with two straws.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I read somewhere that Darren Aronofsky was attached to direct Batman: Year One. How sick would that have been? Ingrid is clearly bored but trying to seem engaged.  65.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh my God. So sick. Pinto leans back, taking in the ambiance.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: This place is fucking tight. Ingrid glances around, visibly unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You come here a lot?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I’m what you’d call a regular. (calling out) Hey, Cindy! What up, girl? A waitress (CINDY) walks by. She pauses, confused.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: Hi. Can I help you? Silence. Pinto laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Cindy, it’s me. Dan Pinto.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: (awkward beat) Oh! Right. Well, um... Let me just finish with this other table and I’1l be right with you, Don.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Dan. She smiles politely and walks off. A long, painful silenc

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I’m sure she’s just really busy.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, totally. Pinto sucks on his straw. More silence.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Go for it.  66.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Why do you like Batman so much?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Gee, I don’t know. Maybe because he’s the most dynamic bad-ass in the history of entertainment?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Really? That’s it? Pinto looks down, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Actually, uh... both my parents died when I was a kid, so... I guess I related to him since we're both orphans. Ingrid stares at Pinto with newfound sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I’m so sorry. I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (shrugs it off) It’s cool. At the time, I didn’t really know how to cope so... I started wearing a Batman mask to school every day and made the teachers call me Bruce. The other kids made fun of me, but I think it kind of helped me to pretend like it happened to someone else. Like, even though I was wearing a mask, I felt more like myself, you know? (beat) What about you?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t really like Batman.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No, I mean, how did your mom die? Ingrid is caught off-guard by Pinto’s sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Heart attack. (adding) She drank a lot.  67.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Were you guys close? Ingrid pauses, as if considering this for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah. We were. It felt like I lost my best friend, you know? Ingrid shrugs it off, eyes welling with tears. Pinto look concerned. He scoots over to Ingrid’s side, consoling her

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sniffing) God, listen to me. You must think I’m the worst.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No way. Are you kidding? (reassuring) I know I might seem like a cold- blooded gangster on the outside, but... I really like you, Ingrid. Ingrid stares at Pinto like no one has ever said this to before. They lock eyes for a long moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid and Pinto are having sweaty, alcohol-fueled sex. Ingrid lies face-down on the bed while Pinto jackhammers from behind. He pauses, catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Wait. Ingrid looks back at him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No, nothing, it’s just... (awkward) Would you mind calling me Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You want me to call you Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Like Bruce Way--  68.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I got it. (turns back around) Fuck me, Bruce. Pinto resumes thrusting with renewed vigor.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Say “Gotham Needs You.”

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Gotham needs you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Say it like Catwoman.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (sexy voice) Gotham needs you. (then) Meow.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Oh shit I’m gonna come -- CLOSE on Ingrid’s face turned to the side as Pinto finish on her back. She stares longingly at something 0.S. HER POV - The framed Instagram photo of her and Taylor in Joshua Tree is propped up on her bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ingrid and Pinto are lying on their backs. Pinto is enjoy a post-coital vape while Ingrid stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were really great, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Thanks. So were you. (awkward) Hey, so... some friends of mine are going up to Malibu this weekend if you wanna come? Pinto looks conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Man I'd love to, but my producer Jeremy's getting married in Martha’s Vineyard this weekend.  69.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (surprised) Oh. Okay. Nevermind then. Ingrid rolls over on her side. Pinto looks panicked.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: You know what? Fuck it. I didn’t feel like schlepping all the way out there anyway. Count me in. Ingrid smiles. She turns back, cuddling up to Pinto.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You're the best, Dan. Pinto places his arms around her, stroking her skin.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Whaddya say? You ready for round two? I can feel the Dark Knight rising...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I'm pretty tired actually.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Yeah, no, me too. I’11 just run and grab my toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Actually, um... Is it okay if you don’t sleep over tonight? I have trouble falling asleep when there's somebody else in bed with me.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah, no worries. Ingrid picks up her phone and starts scrolling through he Instagram. Pinto slips out of bed, getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excited for this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (distracted) Yep. Pinto stands there, nodding awkwardly, then quietly heads out. He pauses at the door, turning back and smiling.  70.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams, Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Pinto exits. Ingrid sighs, feeling relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinto’s truck pulls up outside a beachfront house in Mali Ingrid jumps out followed by Pinto, who is now dressed exactly like Ezra in a felt hat, chambray shirt buttoned the way, white jeans, and a pair of Red Wings.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hurry up! We’re already late.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (tugging his collar) Do I seriously have to keep this buttoned up all the way?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yes. It looks better like that. Don’t be such a baby.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (whiny) I’m not. They make their way down a footpath towards the beach.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Let’s go over some ground rules. First, I kind of need you to act like you're my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: It’s a long story and I can’t really get into it right now but --

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Ingrid, I get it. You don’t have to make up some elaborate story to hide your feelings. It’s obvious you're into me.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Huh?  71.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Relax. I’m into you too. Of course I’ll be your boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Um... okay, fine, whatever. Rule number two. No Batman talk.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: These people don’t care about superheroes, okay? They care about stuff that’s actually cool. Like food and clothes and Joan Didion.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (sighing dramatically) Anything else, your majesty?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yes. Whatever you do, stay away from Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Who's Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, Thorburn! They turn to see Nicky walking up from the beach, wearing Trump hat and neon swim trunks, carrying a bunch of firew

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (hushed; to Pinto) Taylor’s brother. He’s a liar and a drug addict and he’s not to be trusted under any circumstances. (to Nicky) Hey! Sorry, bad traffic --

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (re: Pinto) Who’s this fuggin guy?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nicky, this is Dan Pinto. (no response) My “imaginary” boyfriend? Ingrid smiles. Nicky squints at Pinto, trying to place hi  72.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Wait... Dan Pinto? From Chicago?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Do we know each other?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You're Mark Pinto’s son, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out! Thorburn, why didn’t you tell me? Ingrid looks between Pinto and Nicky with a confused smil

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Tell you what?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend’s dad runs one of the biggest hedge funds in the world. He pulled in over three hundred mil last year. Dude’s a fucking Viking. Ingrid stares at Pinto, who now has a guilty look on his face. He glances awkwardly up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Gonna be a scorcher today, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid and Pinto are in the middle of a heated argument. Pinto is wearing Nicky’s hat for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You told me your parents were dead!

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, okay? I didn’t want you thinking I was just some spoiled rich kid.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What was all that shit about you wearing a Batman mask to school?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: That part was true actually.  73.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Me? You’re the one dressing me up like your little twink so you can impress these hipsters -- There is a KNOCK. Taylor peeks inside, looking concerned.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hey. Is everything okay? Ingrid’s demeanor changes completely. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Totally! We were just talking about how incredible this place is.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Can I grab you guys a drink?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’d love one.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Nicky won’t stop talking about you by the way. I think somebody might have a little man crush. They look out the window to see Nicky building a fire in backyard and holding a lit cigar. He glances up at them.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Pinto! Get your ass down here! I got a Cohiba with your name on it!

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Hell yeah! One sec! Taylor smiles and exits. Pinto turns back to Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did you tell me to stay away from Nicky? From what I can tell, he seems like a pretty chill guy.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: He’s only being nice to you because of your dad! Can’t you see that?!  74.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Oh, right, because there’s no way he could possibly like me for my personality. Is that it? Ingrid sighs, feeling bad.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Fine. You can hang out with him if you want. Just don’t embarrass me. (re: Trump hat) Where did you get that hat?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Nicky gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Take it off. Now. Ingrid glares at Pinto. He sighs, taking it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid comes downstairs to see Taylor and Harley making dinner in the kitchen. She pauses, eavesdropping.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Nicky tells me you guys have a place in Joshua Tree.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yes! Have you been?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: No, but I’m dying to go. I've been thinking of doing a pop-up out there for our resort collection.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay, can I tell you a secret? (beat) It sounds crazy, but I’ve been thinking of buying the house next door to us and turning into a boutique hotel where everything in it is for sale. I’m calling it Desert D’Or. CLOSE on Ingrid as she overhears this, looking hurt.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY CHUNG
dialogues.text: That’s genius. Would you ever consider doing a collaboration?  75.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yes! We should totally join forces. Ingrid steels herself and enters the kitchen, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey! Either of you noble humans need a hand? Taylor and Harley turn, exchanging a confused look.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: “Noble humans”...?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know. The last lines of Deer Park? You said you were obsessed with it so I figured I should read it. So good!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh, cool. Glad you liked it. (to Harley) Hey, why don’t you and Nicky come out next weekend? We’ll take you to Pappy’s. They have great live music and the best desert vibes. Ingrid feels a stab of jealousy. She is about to speak wh Nicky and Pinto enter from outside wearing swim trunks.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Who wants to go skinny dipping?! Nicky pulls down his trunks, revealing a MANGINA. Taylor Harley burst out laughing as Nicky prances around the roo like Mick Jagger. Ingrid looks isolated and miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner has ended and everyone is drinking around a crackl fire. Ingrid takes out her phone, punching in her passwor Feeling eyes on her, she looks up to see Nicky sitting ne to her, glancing over her shoulder. He turns away quickly

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: I was at some tech start-up the other day and they had this absurd art collection... which really bugged me, you know? Like, what kind of statement are they trying to make? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That they, as a company, have good taste? That’s bullshit. You can’t just acquire taste. It’s something you earn, something you cultivate over years and years -- Nicky looks at Pinto making a jerk-off motion. Pinto laug

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Something to add, Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I just don’t think you’d be saying that if they had one of your paintings up on their walls. Ezra pauses, looking flustered.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: You're missing the point. (to Taylor) C’mon, back me up here, babe.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I mean... I kind of agree with Nicky. If someone likes what you're doing and wants to be a part of it, why does it matter what their intentions are? Ezra looks at Taylor, feeling betrayed. He gets up and quietly trudges off down the beach. TAYLOR (CONT’D) Ezra, come back. Ezra gives her the finger. Taylor looks embarrassed. TAYLOR (CONT’D) So, Dan. I hear you're a writer?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Screenwriter, actually.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: What are you working on?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I just finished a draft of my new feature, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) He can’t really talk about it yet.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Fuck that Hollywood bullshit. We're all friends here. Give us your elevator pitch. Pinto looks at Ingrid, not sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Well, it’s kind of a re-imagining of a classic superhero story.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Is it Batman?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: How’d you know?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Ingrid and I were admiring your CD collection on our way to J-Tree.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I always thought the third movie was the most underrated.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Dude, that’s exactly how I feel!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: So when can I read this thing?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Ehh, it’s sort of a work in progress. I was supposed to do a table read a few weeks ago but one of my actresses flaked on me. Pinto shoots a pointed look at Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Let’s do that shit right now. You have it on you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No, but I can email you guys a PDF and we can read it off our phones. Ingrid tenses up. 77.  78.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Come on, guys. Do we really want to be sitting here in this amazing house just staring at our phones the whole night?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m with Ingrid. Ingrid smiles, relieved. Harley shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I dunno. I’ve never acted before. Could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (backpedaling) I mean, I’m down if everyone else is.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Thorburn. Majority rules. Pinto is psyched. Ingrid looks at Taylor, feeling betraye

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: A live read of Pinto’s script is underway. Pinto reads th action aloud while the others follow along on their phone

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: “Catwoman removes the blade from his back and does a backflip off of the roof.” Pinto looks at Ingrid. She reads her lines aloud:

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (monotone) “Sorry, Bruce. If you play with cats, you’re bound to get scratched.” Pinto mouths along to this line, satisfied, as he scrolls

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: “Batman collapses onto the ground, clutching his wound. Through the darkness, we can see blood seeping out from beneath his cape. As the camera cranes upward, we see that the pool of blood has formed into the shape... of a BAT.” (dramatic beat) Fade out.  79. A long silence. Ingrid glances around, trying to gauge everyone’s reaction.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Holy shit, Pinto.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: That bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I told him it needed more work.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. It’s fucking incredible.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Come on. Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was really good. And I don’t even like those movies.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Me neither. I feel like I need to catch my breath. I mean... wow. Pinto blushes. Ingrid looks completely bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I got one note. You ready for it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Bring it on, brother.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You gotta lose the Batman shit. Pinto’s smile fades. A deafening silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: What? That’s the whole movie.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. Fuck no. This is a movie about discovering your true identity in a world where everybody wears masks. Don’t get me wrong, that stuff kills, but I’m just gonna go ahead and assume that you don’t own the rights to the Batman franchise.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Correct.  80.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: So just change all the names and you've got a completely original script on your hands. (shrugs ) But hey, what do I know? You’re the artist. I’m just a fan. Pinto is scrambling to type all of this into his phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: No, keep going. This is great.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I don’t like to talk shop in mixed company. What do you say we continue this conversation in private over some fine Cuban cigars? Excuse us, ladies. Nicky leads Pinto away. Taylor looks around, confused.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen Ezra?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: He’s been gone for a while.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Shit. I'd better go look for him.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I‘1l come with you.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (standing) Me too.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We should split up actually. Harley and I’11 look by the beach. Ingrid, you check the house. Taylor and Harley walk off together, leaving Ingrid alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is walking through the house, knocking on doors an peering inside.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ezra...? Hello...?  81. All the rooms are empty. As she heads for the stairs, she pauses, hearing VOICES coming from a nearby bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid opens the door and freezes. Nicky and Pinto are hunched over, shirtless, chopping up gorilla fingers of c on Pinto’s Batman Forever CD case.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What is going on here?!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What’s it look like, Thorburn? Keep your voice down. Nicky snorts a line, rapidly pumping his fist. Ingrid sho Pinto a look, grabbing the bag of coke and holding it up.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Is this yours?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean... you guys did so much in Joshua Tree, I just assumed you were all huge cokeheads. Ingrid starts cleaning up all the drug paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Getting rid of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, hang on --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Do you know what would happen if your sister found out about this?! Just then, the door opens, revealing Taylor and Harley. Ingrid turns, frozen, still holding the bag of coke.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Seriously, you guys?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Pinto and I were just talking about the script when Ingrid came in and started racking lines --  82.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What?! That is not true! Taylor shakes her head, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Whatever, Nicky. It’s your life. If you wanna waste it, be my guest. Taylor and Harley exit. Nicky makes an ‘eek’ face at Pint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid comes downstairs, chasing after Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Taylor, wait! I can explain!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (turning around) What is there to explain? You knew Nicky was sober.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: It was Dan’s! I had no idea!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Ingrid. I saw how much you did that night at Pappy’s. I was there, okay?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nicky’s lying! I wasn’t doing any!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Doing hard drugs a couple times a year is one thing, but every weekend? Not a good look. Taylor walks off. Harley consoles her, flashing Ingrid a look. Ingrid is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is sitting by herself, smoking a cigarette and sta out at the ocean, when she notices Ezra perched on a rock wearing a towel and drinking wine from the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (squinting) Ezra...? Is that you?  83. He ignores her, taking another swig. Ingrid walks over.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where have you been? We’ve been looking for you all night.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: (distant) I went skinny dipping.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: By yourself? Ezra says nothing. Ingrid sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: No. Not really. (long pause) Do you ever wish you could just walk into the ocean and disappear? Ingrid stares at Ezra, genuinely confused.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Why would you say that? Your life is perfect. Silence. Ezra stares off into space.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Nicky’s right, you know. I’m not an artist. I’m a fucking charlatan.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey, come on. Don’t listen to him. I think your paintings are awesome.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... that makes one of you. So far, you’re my only sale.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (confused) I thought Taylor said they were really popular.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: She would say that, wouldn’t she? Everything's “the best” with her. You have to try this restaurant. It’s “the best”. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you seen these clothes? They’re “the best”. It’s exhausting after a while.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know what you mean. (confessing) When we were in Joshua Tree she told me this secret and she said not to tell anyone, but then I heard her telling the exact same thing to Harley earlier tonight.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: What secret? Ingrid looks at Ezra, debating whether to tell him or not

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Okay, don’t tell her I told you, but... she wants to buy the house next door to you guys and turn it into some hotel-slash-store thing called... Desert D’Or.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Desert D’Or...?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: It’s from her favorite book. The Deer Park. Which fucking sucks by the way. Ezra laughs to himself, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you laughing?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: The Deer Park is my favorite book. Taylor’s never even read it. Ingrid considers this. Ezra pauses, looking wistful.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wish you’d known the old Taylor. Back when she first moved here. She didn’t know anyone yet. She was this total preppie sorority chick. Her favorite band was Coldplay, for fuck’s sake. (faint smile) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was refreshing how earnest she was. Kind of like you, actually. Ingrid seems unsure of how to take this remark. Ezra sigh

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I miss how things used to be. When it was just the two of us. I miss having a day job. I miss waking up and going to the office. I miss being around people... More silence. Ingrid places a hand on Ezra’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry to burden you with all of this, it’s just... Sometimes I feel like I don’t have anyone I can talk to about this stuff, you know? Ezra looks at Ingrid, placing a hand on her thigh.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a good listener.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (blushing) Aw, thanks. So are you. A sweet moment. Ezra smiles at her, his gaze lingering a beat too long. Ingrid looks down, noticing Ezra’s hand making its way up her thigh, towards her crotch --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ezra... He leans in suddenly, kissing her on the mouth. Ingrid pauses, stunned, then pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?! Ezra freezes, looking stunned.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: I thought this is what you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What?! Why would you think that?!

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: I dunno. Why else would you have bought one of my shitty paintings? I’ve seen the way you look at me.  86. Ingrid stares at Ezra in disbelief then storms off toward the house. Ezra chases after her, looking scared.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ingrid, wait! You’re not gonna tell Taylor about this, are you? Ezra grabs Ingrid’s arm, pleading with her.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please don’t tell her. I’m begging you. She’s all I’ve got. Ezra’'s face contorts into a sad grimace. He hunches over crying softly. Ingrid watches, not sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh fuck... (sobbing) Please don’t tell her. Please. I‘1l do anything. We HOLD on Ingrid, an idea dawning on her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid comes downstairs, rubbing her eyes, to see Taylor making coffee and cleaning up from the night before.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Did Ezra ever come home last night? Taylor sighs, wiping her brow.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. He and Nicky got in this huge fight and Ezra told him he can’t live with us anymore. He was acting really strange. You didn’t talk to him, did you?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: The whole coke thing must've set him off I guess. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, Nicky got pissed and made Harley drive him back at five in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh my God. That’s horrible. (extends her arms) Come here. Taylor leans in for a hug. Ingrid wraps her arms around h

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I freaked out at you last night. I was really stressed out and... I know it wasn’t your fault.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No, I’m the one who should be sorry. I had no idea my boyfriend was such a loser. They glance out at the deck, where Pinto is passed out on ground wrapped in a Garfield blanket.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what’s the plan for today?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Ezra thought he and I could use a romantic night together so he booked us a room at the Chateau.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (slightly disappointed) Oh... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Maybe we can grab lunch tomorrow? Ingrid’s face brightens immediately.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Great! Sounds good. Ingrid turns away, a tiny smile forming on her face. I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK (MOVING) - DAY Pinto and Ingrid are driving in hungover silence. Ingrid unplugs her phone and powers it on. She pauses, frowning. ON THE SCREEN - The background image is a PHOTO of Nicky doing the “eat pussy” gesture with his fingers.  88. Ingrid turns to Pinto, confused.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Did you change the background on my phone?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Why would I do that? Ingrid tries typing in her password but it doesn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I think I have someone’s else's phone. Can you try calling me? Pinto dials Ingrid’s number. Waits a beat.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Straight to voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (suddenly anxious) We have to go back.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? We’re almost home.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Well what the hell am I supposed to do without my phone, Dan?!

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Buy a new one? Ingrid gets an idea. She pulls out Rothko’s MISSING DOG flyer from her purse. Ingrid grabs Pinto’s phone and dial

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under his breath) You're welcome... Ingrid rolls her eyes, turning away.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Taylor?! Hey! It’s Ingrid. Have you seen my phone anywhere? I think I may have left it there.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh no, we found it.  89.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You did? Thank God...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, Nicky has it. He said he grabbed it this morning by accident. All the blood instantly drains from Ingrid’s face.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nicky...?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I gave him your address. He said he’d be in touch. (silence) Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid walks up. There is a note taped to the door that reads: “Mélisse, 8 PM. Love, Nicky :-)"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fancy French restaurant. Ingrid enters to see Nicky sea at a table with an array of food, talking to a WAITER and consulting a wine list. He looks up as she approaches.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Thorburn! You made it. Have a seat. You prefer red or white?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Uh... I’m good, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No, no. I insist. (to Waiter) What’s your most expensive bottle?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: That would be the ‘82 Chateau Lafite.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: And how much is that?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Three-thousand nine-hundred, sir.  90.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Perfect. The Waiter scuttles off. Ingrid takes a seat across from him, watching as Nicky garnishes a plate of oysters. NICKY (CONT’D) I don’t know about you but I could really use a drink right about now.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Where’s my phone, Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Phone? What phone? (quick beat) Oh, you mean this? He pulls out Ingrid’s phone from his pocket. NICKY (CONT’D) Funny. My sister has the exact same case. You guys are so similar it’s almost... creepy.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Give it back. Ingrid reaches for her phone but Nicky yanks it away.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I gotta hand it to you, that was a bold move, convincing Ezra to throw me out on my ass like that.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Come on, Thorburn. You might have my sister fooled but not me. That’s the thing about Taylor. She only wants to see the best in people. Me? I’m the exact opposite. I knew you were bad news from the moment I saw you. And now I have proof. Ingrid watches as Nicky punches in her password.  91. NICKY (CONT’D) It’s amazing how much you can learn about someone just by looking through their phone. (swiping through) Here's a picture of you with my sister’s dog. Here’s the inside of her medicine cabinet. Here’s one of her sleeping. There’s a lot of those. But my personal favorite are the notes. These really kill me. (reading) “Taylor’s favorite brunch spots” “Taylor's favorite books” “Taylor's favorite music”... This one’s just called “TAYLOR” and is basically a list of everything she owns --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Look, I’m not a bad person, okay? I just want to be her friend. Can I please have my phone back? Nicky winces, sucking air.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Can’t do it, Ingrid. This is just too good an opportunity to pass up. You're fucked here no matter what. So here’s the deal. I’m not gonna give you your phone back, but... I would consider renting it to you. For a nominal fee, of course.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (sighs) How much do you want?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You pay me, let’s say... five grand once a week and I promise not to tell my sister and everyone else in L.A. what a fucking loser you are.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Once a week? For how long?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What do you mean? For however long you want your friendship with my sister to continue.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I don’t have that kind of money.  92.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sure you do. Disco Dan told me all about your dead mom and your backpack full of cash. Makes sense. How else could someone with no job afford to drop everything and move to L.A. Ingrid swallows, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I can pay you the five grand but that’s it.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: This isn’t a negotiation, Ingrid. Ingrid stares at Nicky, shaking her head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Fine. Now can I have my phone back, please? Nicky smiles. He slides her phone across the table.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m staying at the Jolly Roger down by the marina. Room 237. The waiter appears, presenting the bottle of expensive wi

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Here you are, sir. This is the Chateau Lafite 1982 --

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Thanks, boss. I got this. The waiter leaves the bottle on the table and exits. Nick pours a glass and holds it up to his nose, inhaling deepl NICKY (CONT’D) Cheers. Nicky downs the entire glass. He grabs the bottle of wine and stands, motioning to all of the half-eaten food. NICKY (CONT’D) This one’s on you by the way. Nicky exits, whistling to himself. We HOLD on Ingrid, eye burning with hatred...  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid rides her bike home, looking spun out. She pauses a stoplight and stares up at a billboard. HER POV - A battered woman’s face with the caption, “IF Y CAN SEE IT, YOU CAN CHANGE IT. DON’T TURN A BLIND EYE.” She hears laughter nearby, noticing a group of TEENAGE BO smoking weed at a playground across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys all look up, whispering as Ingrid approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FAT BOY
dialogues.text: Can we help you?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I‘'1l give one of you two hundred bucks to punch me in the face. Silence, then... the boys burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: FAT BOY
dialogues.text: Yo, get the fuck outta here! Ingrid pulls out two hundred in cash. The boys get quiet.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: If you pussies can’t handle it I'll find someone else. The boys all shake their heads, muttering to themselves. Ingrid is about to leave when one the boys steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BOY
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I/’11 do it. The other boys start shouting and covering their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER BOYS
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Hell yeah!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (to Tall Boy) You ready?

dialogues.speaker: TALL BOY
dialogues.text: Let me see that money first. Ingrid hands him two hundred dollars. One of the other bo starts filming the whole thing with his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hit me as hard as you can. Right in the face. The Tall Boy readies himself, having second thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BOY
dialogues.text: You sure about this? Ingrid nods, closing her eyes. The Tall Boy winds up and PUNCHES HER RIGHT IN THE FACE... Ingrid doubles over, clutching her face and moaning. The Tall Boy feels guilty. He puts his arm on Ingrid’s back. TALL BOY (CONT’D) You okay? Ingrid nods. She stands, revealing her face. It’s bright red and she has a cut on her nose that is bleeding profus

dialogues.speaker: OTHER BOYS
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Damn! You got fucked up! Ingrid gets in the Tall Boy’s face, egging him on.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: That all you got, bitch?

dialogues.speaker: TALL BOY
dialogues.text: (backing away) Yo, let’s get the fuck out of here. The boys look disturbed, turning and sprinting away. PRE-LAP: A fist pounding urgently on a door. EXT. PINTO’S HOUSE - LATE NIGHT Pinto opens his door, rubbing the sleep out of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Ingrid? It’s four in the morning-- His expression falls when he sees Ingrid, now sporting a prominent shiner under her left eye and crying profusely. INT. PINTO’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ingrid is on the couch, wrapped in a blanket and sipping Monster Energy Drink while Pinto paces back and forth.  95.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: -- when I got home, I turned on the lights and Nicky was there waiting for me. He seemed drunk or on drugs or something. I asked him for my phone back but he wouldn’t give it to me. He said he wanted fifty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Are you fucking serious right now?!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I told him I didn’t have that kind of cash, but he didn’t believe me. He said you told him about the money my mom left me. (hurt) Is that true? Pinto is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I mean... I don’t know! We were so fucked up! I may have mentioned it at some point --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Dan! Why would you do that?! I told you how dangerous he was!

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I’m calling the cops. Pinto reaches for his phone but Ingrid stops him.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No! He said he’d kill me if I told anyone. Please. You don’t know what he’s capable of.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: This is bullshit! We can’t let him get away with this! (beat) You want me to go pound his ass?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No, Dan. Believe me, I don’t like this any more than you do but if we're going to do something we have to be smart about it. Pinto looks at Ingrid, intrigued.  96.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: What’d you have in mind? I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK - NIGHT Ingrid and Pinto are parked outside of the JOLLY ROGER MO Pinto is wearing a trenchcoat and dressed in all black.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: You really think this'll work? THEIR POV - Nicky’s red Ford Mustang is parked in the lot

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You're asking me this now? After I just bought a thousand dollars worth of cocaine? Yes, I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: What if someone sees me?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You’1l be in and out in two minutes. Just break into his car, plant the drugs, and leave. Pinto pulls on a BATMAN MASK and picks up a crowbar.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (deep breath) Rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinto hops out of his car and zig-zags through the parkin lot, keeping his head low. He pulls out a walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) Ingrid, do you read me? Over. INTERCUT WITH -- I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK - CONTINUOUS Ingrid speaks into her walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Yes, Dan. I can hear you. Pinto arrives at Nicky’s car. He notices Nicky has left h driver's side window slightly cracked.  97.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: We got an open window here. I think I can fit my arm inside so we should be good to go.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Copy that. Great work, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: 10-4. Commencing radio silence. CLICK. Pinto switches off his radio.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Wait, what? No. Keep your radio on. Hello? Dan...?! Ingrid sighs. She puts down the walkie-talkie and picks u her phone, dialing 9-1-1. The EMERGENCY OPERATOR answers.

dialogues.speaker: EMERGENCY OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 9-1-1. What’s your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (frantic) Help! I’m at the Jolly Roger Motel in Marina Del Rey and there’s a man dealing drugs out of his car! It’s a red Ford Mustang convertible!

dialogues.speaker: EMERGENCY OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Okay, ma’am, try and stay calm. What is your name, please?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh my god, he has a gun! Hurry! Ingrid hangs up the phone and smiles. Pinto rolls up his sleeve and squeezes his arm through th window, tossing the bag of coke onto the driver’s seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: (smiles) Mission accomplished. He tries pulling his arm back out but it won’t budge. The gap is too narrow. He tries again. Still nothing. Ingrid watches as Pinto struggles to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Use the crowbar!  98. But Pinto can’t hear her. Ingrid notices something out he window and her expression falls. She slides down in her seat, peering over the steering wheel to see --

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: -- walking up with a RANDOM COLLEGE GIRL, drunk and laugh Ingrid picks up the walkie-talkie, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hissing; into radio) Dan! Abort! Abort mission! Not knowing what else to do, Ingrid HONKS the horn. Nicky pauses, hearing the car horn. He looks around, seei Pinto with his arm stuck in the car window.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Holy shit. That’s my car, you son of a bitch! Nicky starts sprinting towards his car at full speed. Pinto turns just in time to see Nicky running towards him

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Pinto SMASHES THE WINDOW with the crowbar, freeing his ar and takes off in the opposite direction. Ingrid watches, helpless, as Nicky sprints towards Pinto full speed, tackling him onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (covering her mouth) Oh my God! CLOSE on Nicky as he pulverizes Pinto with a string of relentless punches. The girl comes running over.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM COLLEGE GIRL
dialogues.text: Stop! You’re gonna kill him! Nicky pauses, catching his breath. He looks down at Pinto unresponsive, the mask still covering his face. Nicky coc his head to the side, reaching down to lift up the mask a A COP CAR comes barreling around the corner, screeching t halt. Nicky turns to see TWO COPS jump out, guns drawn.  99.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING GROUND, ASSHOLE
dialogues.text: Nicky stands, confused, raising his hands in the air. The COPS run over and forcibly throw Nicky on the ground, cuf him from behind. The girl is yelling at them to stop. One of the cops comes over to Pinto, surveying the damage CLOSE on masked Pinto, mouth bloody, a few teeth missing.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. (into radio) Send an ambulance, now. The first cop shines his flashlight through Nicky’s car window, noticing the bag of coke on the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Well, well. What do we have here? Ingrid quietly slips out of Pinto’s truck, tip-toeing awa from the scene unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinto is lying in a hospital bed, unconscious, wearing a brace, his forehead wrapped in bandages and a tube sticki out of his mouth. An EKG machine BEEPS continuously. Ingrid is sitting next to his bed, watching a commercial TV for Dominos Cinna Stix. Her phone RINGS. It’s Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (excited) Hey, girl! What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (flatly) Hey. You called me? Ingrid reacts to her tone. Her voice seems cold and dista

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I was... just checking in. Hadn't heard from you in a few days so --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now’s not really a good time.  100.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nicky’s in jail.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Have you talked to him?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No, not yet. Ingrid closes her eyes, giving herself a little fist pump

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Taylor, I am so sorry. Do you want to grab a coffee and talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Shit, I gotta go. It’s my mom.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Okay. Feel better -- CLICK. Ingrid hangs up, feeling uncertain. I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK - DAY Ingrid is sitting in Pinto’s truck, wearing the same clot from the night before, eating a box of Dominos Cinna Stix HER POV - She is parked across the street from Taylor's house. Taylor’s car is gone and the curtains are drawn. Ingrid looks at her phone, refreshing her Instagram feed. ON THE SCREEN - A recent INSTAGRAM PHOTO of Taylor’s Josh Tree house with the caption:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Last minute escape to J Tree. Joni Mitchell on repeat. Hashtag blue. I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK (MOVING) - DAY Ingrid is driving at full speed through the desert, blast Joni Mitchell’s “Blue” through the speakers. I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK (MOVING) - LATER Ingrid pulls up outside of Taylor’s house in Joshua Tree.  101. HER POV - The driveway is empty. No one’s home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are inside the house looking out through the sliding g doors leading out to the patio. Ingrid appears, pressing face against the glass and peering inside. She KNOCKS twi

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (muffled) Hello?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid walks up to the Airstream and KNOCKS on the door. tries the handle and it opens. She peeks inside. HER POV - The trailer is empty, its contents undisturbed. Ingrid sighs, frustrated. She checks her phone again. ON THE SCREEN - A recent INSTAGRAM PHOTO of Taylor at Pap Harriet’s holding a margarita with the caption:

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s five o’clock somewhere. Umbrella drink emoji. INT. PAPPY & HARRIET’S - DAY Ingrid is sitting by herself at the bar, sipping a margar HER POV - Regulars mill about but there’s no sign of Tayl Ingrid types out a text message to Taylor on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hey girl! Saw your Instagram. I’m actually in Joshua Tree with some friends for a yoga retreat. Wanna hang later? Dancing Ladies Emoji. She hits SEND and downs the rest of her drink. EXT. ROY’S MOTEL & CAFE - DAY Ingrid stands in front of the sign, talking on the phone.  102.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey! It’s Ingrid. I’m at Roy’s right now. Remember when we took that picture? So fun. (awkward beat) Anyway... just wondering if you got my text message. Still haven't heard from you. Hope everything's okay. Talk to you later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is sitting in their driveway. Her thumb hovers ove Taylor’s name, debating whether or not to call again. She presses the CALL button. A beat as it rings, then --

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ezra! Hey! Where are you guys?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're at dinner. Why?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, I saw on Taylor’s Instagram that you guys were in Joshua Tree and I’m actually here randomly on a yoga retreat so I thought maybe we could --

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ingrid. We’re not in Joshua Tree.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You're not?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No. We’re in L.A. staying at a friend’s house. Funny how you just happened to be there right when Taylor posted about it.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: (sighs) Look, I don’t know how to say this, but... Taylor doesn’t want to see you anymore.  Silence. 103. Ingrid feels a sharp pain in her chest.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ezra, put Taylor on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want to talk to you either.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Okay, well... should I call back tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ingrid. It’s over, okay? Nicky told us everything. Don’t call us anymore.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ezra, wait -- (click) Hello...? Ezra? The line is dead. We HOLD on Ingrid’s face for a long bea as she tries to process what just happened...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ingrid is on the phone, pacing the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi, you’ve reached Taylor. Leave a message. (BEEP)

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey. It’s Ingrid. I just hada weird call with Ezra and I feel like we should talk about this. I don’t know what Nicky said to you but... he’s lying. The fact is, he’s a drug addict and he can’t be trusted, so... (beat) Call me back. (quick beat) It’s Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi, you’ve reached Taylor. Leave a message. (BEEP)  104.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey! Me again! Still haven't heard back. I’m starting to worry. This isn’t like you. Call me!

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Ingrid is sitting in Pinto’s truck, polishing off a Coron

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi, you’ve reached Taylor. Leave a message. (BEEP)

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You think you’re so cool, huh? (Taylor voice) Ooh, look at me. I’m Taylor. I take lots of pictures and my life is so perfect... NOT. Turns out, I’m a huge bitch who won't admit that my brother’s a criminal and my husband is a sad loser who still uses a flip-phone. I saved your dog's life! The least you could do is pick up your fucking phone!

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Ingrid is laying on the hood of Pinto’s truck. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Sorry about that last message. I was just kidding... Gotcha! I’11 be around for the next hour or so if you wanna talk -- (beep) Oh, hang on, you're beeping in. (perking up) Hey!

dialogues.speaker: EZRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Listen, you fucking psycho. If you don’t stop this shit right fucking now, I’m calling the fucking cops, you understand? It’s five in the fucking morning. Just leave us the fuck alone! CLICK. Ingrid looks stunned. She hits redial.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The voice mailbox you are trying to reach is full and cannot accept new messages. Goodbye.  105. Ingrid closes her eyes, breathing heavily. I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK - MORNING Ingrid is asleep in the front seat, her hair matted to he forehead, her lips dry and cracked. A MAIL MAN walks up a peers through the window. He knocks, startling her awake.

dialogues.speaker: MAIL MAN
dialogues.text: (muffled) You okay, miss? You shouldn’t sleep in your truck. It’s too hot. Ingrid squints at the Mail Man, confused and dehydrated.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (a whisper) I’m fine. Thanks. She starts her car. As Ingrid pulls away, she notices the empty house next to Taylor and Ezra’s place and stops. HER POV - There is a “FOR SALE” sign in the front yard wi photo of a long-haired man in a grey suit and bolo tie. INT. REALTOR’S OFFICE - DAY Ingrid sits across from the realtor in the photo, GARTH LAFAYETTE, 60s, long hair, grey suit and bolo tie.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH LAFAYETTE
dialogues.text: Which property did you say you were interested in?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: 22 Flamingo Lane.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH LAFAYETTE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, the couple who lives next door already made an offer on that house. I do have a handful of other properties in that same price range --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I don’t want another property. I want that one. Garth looks at her for a beat, puzzled. He chuckles.  106.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH LAFAYETTE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sorry, Miss Thorburn, but there’s not much I can do. If you'd like, I can add your name to a waiting list and we’ll give you a call if anything changes -- Ingrid places her L.L. Bean backpack on the table, unzipp it to reveal the last of her cash.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: It’s all the money I have. Please. Garth leans back in his chair, scratching his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: The “FOR SALE” sign now has a “SOLD” slapped across Ingrid is unloading her things from Pinto’s truck when sh HEARS a screen-door slam. She looks up to see Taylor storming across the yard towards her. Ingrid waves, beami

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey! There you are! I’ve been trying to reach you all week --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I don’t believe this! I specifically told you I wanted this house!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I bought it for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I figured we could join forces.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: On what?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Um, hello? Desert D’Or. Our little secret, remember?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: My brother is in jail right now because of you. I can’t believe I actually thought we were friends.  107.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: We are friends!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No, we're not! You’re just some stranger who found me on Instagram!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Okay, I think we’re both feeling a little emotional right now. Why don’t we go to Pappy’s, have a margarita and just talk about this? Taylor turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Taylor, wait! (beat) I really didn’t want to have to be the one to say this but... Ezra cheated on you. Taylor turns around, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: He tried to finger me in Malibu. He made me promise not to tell you, but I just don’t want to see you get hurt. Taylor backs away. She looks like she’s about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You're a fucking liar. Stay the fuck away from me. Taylor walks off. Ingrid calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I'll be right here if you need me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid sits on the floor, looking through her back window with a pair of binoculars, eating popcorn from a bag. HER POV - Through the back window, we can SEE Taylor and having a heated argument. Ezra storms outside, gets into car and speeds off. Taylor collapses on the couch, sobbin  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Ingrid steps outside and freezes. HER POV - Pinto’s truck has been keyed with various curse words and derogatory terms for the female anatomy. Ingrid turns, looking back at the house. A WIDER ANGLE reveals the words “EAT SHIT AND DIE” have a been spray-painted across the entire front of the house i the same font that Ezra used in his artwork. MUSIC CUE: THE LOUVIN BROTHERS “SATAN IS REAL”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK through the living room, revealing the place is Grey Gardens-style mess. The house is falling apart and there are clothes and fast food wrappers strewn around. Dirty dishes are piled in the sink and swarming with flie REVEAL Ingrid sitting on the toilet, talking on the phone She has no make-up on, her hair is a mess and she’s weari designer dress covered in food stains.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I sent you a check two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER SERVICE AGENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, your account is still showing as past due.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Look, just give me one more week.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER SERVICE AGENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ma’am, this is simply a courtesy call. If you don’t pay your bill in the next twenty-four hours we're going to have to shut off your electricity. Now, we do offer a payment plan for customers experiencing financial hardship -- Ingrid hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Asshole. She reaches for the toilet paper but the roll is empty. S sighs, looking around for something she can use.  109. HER POV - Her vintage copy of Joan Didion’s The White Alb is sitting on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ingrid plunges the toilet, angrily. The book lies open on the floor, a handful of pages torn out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is at the register. A teenage CASHIER rings her up

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Fourteen eighty-six. Ingrid empties her pockets, dumping a handful of crumpled bills and coins on the counter. The cashier watches as sh sifts through. It’s clear that she does not have enough.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe we can take something off? Ingrid looks at her items. A six-pack of Corona and a big thing of toilet paper. I/E. PINTO’S TRUCK (MOVING) - DAY Ingrid is driving up to her house when she notices a rent car parked out front. As she pulls into the driveway, she sees Erin and Keith are standing in front of the house wi the words “EAT SHIT AND DIE” hanging above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid gets out of the truck with her grocery bag, confus

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We hadn’t heard from you. We just wanted to make sure you were okay.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Didn't you get my letter?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you haven’t responded to any of our calls or emails.  110.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Things have been pretty crazy. (quick beat) How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Your name popped up on a police database after you bought this place. (re: plastic bag) What you got there, Ingrid?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Just some groceries. CLOSE on the plastic bag which contains a six-pack of Cor and nothing else. Ingrid looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on in. I’11 give you the tour. Ingrid heads inside. Keith and Erin exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid unpacks her “groceries” while Erin and Keith take look around, reacting to the squalor.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Sorry about the mess. I’ve been doing all the renovations myself. (pause) Can I get you guys anything?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I'd love a water.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: My water’s on the fritz right now. How ‘bout a Corona instead? Ingrid pops the tops off of three bottles of Corona and h one to Erin and Keith, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cheers! Welcome to Cali. (they clink) So... how’s Logan? An uncomfortable silence. Ingrid takes a long swig.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Ingrid. We’re worried about you.  111.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Why would you be worried about me?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Look at this place. Look at how you're living.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You’re the one who told me to start over.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: This isn’t what we had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We think you should come home.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I am home.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Ingrid, this isn’t healthy. The house is a mess. You’re drinking beer at eleven A.M. on a Tuesday. It’s like mom all over again.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You know what? We’re done here. So nice of you to drop by.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You need help, Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, now you want to help me?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: (confused) What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You didn’t seem so eager to help me when mom got sick. Erin looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: That is not fair. I did everything I could --

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You did everything you could for yourself. You’re so selfish it makes me wanna puke.  112.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: What did you want me to do? Mom was a black hole that neither of us was ever going to fill. So you know what? I moved on.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No, you left me to clean up the mess. You abandoned us.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I didn’t abandon you! I did what I needed to do for my own sanity!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh. Now I get it. (then) Well if I’m so crazy, then why you don’t you do us all a favor and stay the fuck out of my life?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: (to Erin) Let’s go. We’re leaving. Erin stares at Ingrid, eyes welling with tears.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You heard me. Get the fuck out. Keith ushers Erin outside, shaking his head at Ingrid. We HOLD on Ingrid for a long moment, feeling guilty...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Erin, wait -- She opens the front door in time to see Erin and Keith pulling away. Ingrid watches them drive off, looking sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid is sitting in the dark, staring at her phone, her illuminated by the light of the screen. ON THE SCREEN - She is posting an OLD PHOTO of her and he Mom on Halloween. Ingrid is dressed as Dorothy and her mo is on the couch, looking frail, dressed as the Wicked Wit

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, Mom. Hashtag TBT.  113. She is about to hit the ‘SHARE’ button when the screen suddenly goes blank. The battery icon appears.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No no no no no... She jams her thumb on the home button repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. Please. Ingrid tries plugging the phone into the wall but nothing happens. She tries one of the light switches. Nothing. Ingrid collapses onto the floor, moaning. The house is eerily quiet. A beat, then -- We HEAR voices, music and laughter drifting across the backyard. Ingrid looks up, peering through the blinds. HER POV - Taylor is having a Halloween party. The lights on and there are people in costumes, drinking and dancing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A costume party is underway. MUSIC blasts as Ingrid enter wearing a sheet with eye holes, weaving through the crowd She finds an outdoor outlet and plugs in her phone, notic a platter of tiny sandwiches on the table next to her. Sh grabs one and lifts her sheet, devouring it quickly. Ingrid stuffs a few more into her pocket and is about to for the bar when she hears a familiar voice. She turns. HER POV - Taylor is standing nearby, dressed as Cher from Clueless and talking to Harley who is dressed as Dionne. Ingrid tries to quickly walk past them when someone steps her sheet, pulling it off her in one fell swoop. She scrambles to cover herself when Taylor looks over, confus

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Ingrid...? Ingrid covers herself with the sheet, pretending not to h TAYLOR (CONT’D) Ingrid, I can see you. We all can. Everyone turns, staring at Ingrid. Ingrid slowly removes sheet, trying to play it cool.  114.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Hey, Taylor. Happy Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? You weren’t invited.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: The music was really loud, so... if you wouldn't mind keeping it down, I have an important meeting tomorrow, SO...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: A meeting for what?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (sadly) What the fuck do you care? A dude starts filming the confrontation with his phone. Ezra appears from inside, sporting a new short haircut an moustache and dressed as Bernie from Weekend at Bernie’s.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: You want me to call the cops?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (re: Ezra) You're still with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Not that it’s any of your business, but our marriage is fine. Unlike you, we’re working through our issues.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: I’m ninety days sober.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (proudly) Ezra’s a concept designer for Levis.
