dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I know, I saw your Instagram. Congratulations.  115.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Go home, Ingrid. People like you aren’t welcome here. Ingrid starts to leave then pauses, turning.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ezra told me everything, you know. How you used to dress like a sorority girl. How your favorite band was Coldplay. How when you moved here you didn’t have any friends. You were just like me. Ezra says nothing. Taylor looks at Ingrid with pity.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I was never like you, Ingrid. A long, painful silence. Everyone stares down at their fe CLOSE on Ingrid, fighting back tears. She nods, taking a deep breath, steeling herself...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: If you could keep the music down I'd really appreciate it. Ingrid walks back towards her house. She pauses, turning around. Everyone watches as she walks across the entire party and unplugs her phone.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forgot my phone. Ingrid exits once again. A long beat, then -- Everyone resumes dancing and partying as if nothing happe We TRACK with Ingrid as she walks across the desert, the party continuing behind her, tears running down her cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: A cheap tealight candle being lit with a match. Ingrid is seated on the floor of her now-spotless living room, surrounded by lit candles. She stares at her phone. POV —- THROUGH AN IPHONE CAMERA We are CLOSE on Ingrid’s face as she presses the red RECO button on an Instagram video. She takes a deep breath.  116.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: They say that friends are the family you choose, but... What if the people you choose don’t choose you? (pause) I thought moving to L.A. would be my chance to start over. A chance to live the life I always wanted -- The video STOPS at the 15-second limit. Ingrid sighs. She presses ‘Share’ and hits the record button again.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought if I made my life seem perfect and happy, maybe someone would choose me, but... it didn’t matter. I guess the problem is me. The only person who ever chose me is gone now, so... why even bother? (pause) I’m so tired -- The video STOPS recording.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit! Ingrid presses ‘Share’ and hits the record button again.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm tired of having to pretend to be something I’m not. I guess the reason I’m doing this is because I wanted to show people the real me, if only this one time. So... (shrugs ) Here I am. Silence. Ingrid picks up a bottle of prescription pills a dumps it into her mouth, washing it down with a Corona an wincing. She hits the ‘Share’ button and sets down her ph Ingrid lies back onto the floor, surrounded by candles, a presses play on her laptop. Seal’s “KISS FROM A ROSE” pla She sets up the framed Instagram photo of her and Taylor smiles at it one last time. She leans her head back and closes her eyes, drifting away, finally at peace...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ingrid? (beat) Ingrid? Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Ingrid’s eyes. After a beat, they flutter open.. HER POV - A NURSE is hovering over us, smiling warmly.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: There she is. Ingrid looks down at her body, realizing she is in a hosp bed. She tries to sit up but the nurse eases her back dow NURSE (CONT’D) Whoa, whoa. Slow down, girl.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (groggy) Where’s my phone...? Ingrid glances around the room. It is filled with FLOWERS BALLOONS, CARDS and STUFFED ANIMALS.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: gifts) What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Apparently you’ve got a lot of fans out there. As a matter of fact, one of them is here to see you. Ingrid stares at the nurse, confused.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Taylor...? We HEAR the sound of a motorized wheelchair coming down t hall. DAN PINTO enters, wearing a halo brace. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: ‘Sup, Ingrid! Ingrid seems disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Dan’s the reason you’re still with us. You're a lucky girl.  118.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: I saw your three-part suicide note on Instagram and called 9-1-1. Ingrid stares at him, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You still follow me? Pinto looks at her as if he doesn’t understand the questi

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: ‘Course. You’re my girl, Ingrid. Ingrid looks touched. Her eyes well up with tears.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I’ll leave you two alone. She smiles at them and exits.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Whaddya think of my new wheels? Pinto spins around in his wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turns out getting my neck broken was the best thing that ever happened to me. I had so much time on my hands that I completely retooled my script. And guess what?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: You sold it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Not quite. But people are really responding to the material. I have an agent now and I just got staffed on a TV show. How sick is that? Ingrid manages a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: That’s great, Dan. I’m really happy for you. Pinto frowns, sensing something is not right.  119.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO
dialogues.text: Hey. Why so serious? (smiles) I know what’1ll cheer you up. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out INGRID’S PHONE. Ingrid’s face lights up. She looks at the home screen. He notification list is flooded with comments from people on Instagram. A headline at the top reads: “You have 27,683 new followers.” Ingrid stares at the number in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PINTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some chick from the Huffington Post got hold of your suicide vids and re-posted the shit out of ‘em. Your face is all over the internet. You’ve even got your own hashtag. (beat) Hashtag... I Am Ingrid. Ingrid opens up her Instagram. As she scrolls through all the comments, we HEAR each one being read aloud:

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE GIRL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We love you, Ingrid!!!

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE BRO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Stay strong, Ingrid. Flex emoji.

dialogues.speaker: ARGENTINIAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello, Ingrid. I’m from Argentina. I saw your video. I think you are beautiful inside and outside.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE GIRL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I feel like we should be best friends. Please follow me?

dialogues.speaker: AND PRAISE COMING FASTER AND FASTER...
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Ingrid as she feels this outpouring of love from Many complete strangers. Her heart swells. Her breath shortens. Her face scrunches up as tears roll down her cheeks. A SMILE spreads across Ingrid’s face as we -- CUT TO BLACK.
